chapter.1.quest.1.description.1:
There are couple of new mechanics that this pack employs, descriptions of which you will find following this quest.
You can always come back here to read them again.


- Gain variable benefits for eating a greater variety of foods.
- Harvest groups of blocks at time to speed up mining, harvesting, and tilling.
- more Piglins behaviors
- progressive difficulty(including bosses)
- bleeding
- new nether portal mechanics
chapter.1.quest.1.task.1.title: New mechanics and features
chapter.1.quest.10.description.1:
Difficulty will increase over time per-player, after 10 in-game days.


As the difficulty increases mobs gain increased stats (damage, speed, health, knockback, magic resistance) and will spawn with more equipment that can be enchanted.


The strength of mobs is determined by the average difficulty of nearby players.
chapter.1.quest.10.task.1.title: Scaling Difficulty
chapter.1.quest.11.description.1:
Each time you kill the Wither, Elder Guardian or Ender Dragon, the difficulty of the fight increases, giving them stronger stats and abilities, while also giving increased rewards and experience.


Wither
- Summons Wither Skeletons. Drops Nether Star Shards.


Ender Dragon
- Summons Shulkers and Endermite.


Elder Guardian
- Summons Guardians. Drops Sponges and Elder Guardian Spikes.
chapter.1.quest.11.task.1.title: Progressive Bosses
chapter.1.quest.12.description.1:
The game progress is divided into three parts: Normal Mode, Expert Mode, and Master Mode. These are not per-player, and affect the whole world.


- Normal Mode starts at the beginning of the game.


- Expert Mode starts when anyone kills the Wither. (or enters the End)


- Master Mode starts when the Ender Dragon is defeated by someone.
chapter.1.quest.12.task.1.title: Progressive Difficulty
chapter.1.quest.13.description.1:
- Groups of enemies
Enemies appear in groups with one leader and followers who attack the same target as the leader. Followers are more likely to have weapons and leaders to have armors.


- Undead Army (new Raid)
The new raid starts after killing a certain amount of undead enemies. It has 3-5 waves, scales difficulty over time, and rewards the player with a treasure bag after finishing it. Also scales difficulty with each player participating in!


- fall damage can causes Slowness and Nausea


- drowning damage can causes Nausea and Weakness


- Creepers may spawn with a negative effect


- animals (like Wolves), Zombies, and Spiders can bite you causing Bleeding


- arrows and direct damage from sharp items (tools, weapons, shears) also can cause Bleeding


- touching a cactus also may cause Bleeding
chapter.1.quest.13.subtitle: Some of the new difficulty mechanics:
chapter.1.quest.13.task.1.title: New difficulty mechanics
chapter.1.quest.13.title: Normal mode changes
chapter.1.quest.14.description.1:
Eating a variety of nutrients, with the right balance, will grant you buffs, while having a bad diet will give you debuffs.


Food now has tooltips that show which nutrients they provide, along with the total number of Nutritional Units (NUs).


To see Nutritional Balance, press the Nutrient Gui keybind (Default: N) or click the bread icon in your inventory.


- Blue indicates your current NUs for each category
- Green lines show the range for buffs
- Red lines indicate malnourishment and engorgement, which gives you debuffs
chapter.1.quest.14.subtitle: Benefits for eating variety of foods
chapter.1.quest.14.task.1.title: Dietary Diversity
chapter.1.quest.15.description.1:
There are new villager jobs, trades, workstations, and advancements!


- Oceanographer (Oceanography Table)


- Forester (Forestry Bench)


- Engineer (Blueprint Table)


- Florist (Gardening Table)


- Hunter (Hunting Post)


- Netherologist (Decayed Workbench)


- Enderologist (Purpur Altar)


- Apiarist (Honey Pot)
chapter.1.quest.15.task.1.title: Improved villagers
chapter.1.quest.16.description.1:
Lost Trinkets adds more than 50 unlockable trinkets with different abilities and rarities.


Trinkets are randomly unlocked during some activities like killing enemies and bosses, trading, mining ores, cutting trees, and farming. Each activity has a different chance of unlocking a trinket.


You can access the Trinkets GUI with its keybind (Default: R). Here you can equip them and unlock more slots.


========================


There are also countless curios which have their own slot in your Curio Inventory which you can open with the icon in your inventory, or with a keybind (Default: G).
chapter.1.quest.16.task.1.title: Trinkets and Curios
chapter.1.quest.17.description.1:
- loot has a 25% chance to be doubled


- experience from all sources is increased by 20%


- all monsters have their health and damage increased by 20%(at night the bonus is doubled to 40%)


- Illusioner spawn naturally during the night


- new Elite Skeleton spawn naturally during the night(shoots arrows extremely precisely)


- Piglins may spawn in a group


- Pillagers may spawn in a group


- Creepers on explosion may spawn more Creeperlings


- Slimes have a chance to inflict Slowness effect


- Wither Skeletons may spawn with the Wither Sword instead of the Stone Sword


- Undead Army now has 4 waves


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are twice as likely to have enchanted items


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are twice as likely to have armor pieces


- Undead Army gives 100% more experience for completing it


- whenever you die from Bleeding or are killed by a Zombie there spawns a special Zombie with your head
chapter.1.quest.17.subtitle: - Expert Mode starts when the first player kills the Wither
chapter.1.quest.18.description.1:
- loot has a 75% chance to be doubled


- experience from all sources is increased by 50%


- all monsters have their health and damage increased by 40% (instead of 20% chance)(at night the bonus is doubled to 80%)


- Phantom and new End Keeper spawn naturally near new structures


- Elite Skeleton may spawn in a group


- Enderman may teleport target on hit


- Shulker may inflict Blindness effect


- Creepers on explosion may spawn more Creeperlings


- Undead Army now has 5 waves


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are quadruple as likely to have enchanted items


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are thrice as likely to have armor pieces


- Undead Army now rewards with 2 Treasure Bags (instead of 1)


- Undead Army gives 200% more experience for completing it (instead of 100%)
chapter.1.quest.18.subtitle: - Master Mode starts when you defeat the Ender Dragon.
chapter.1.quest.19.description.1:
Corail Tombstone handles your death in Minecraft by providing tons of configuration options, many features to encourage to discover the world and several compatibilities between mods.


It also introduces a perk system : the Knowledge of Death, and a magic system based on some enchantable items with the help of the Souls haunting the Decorative Graves and waiting for a way to be freed for their eternal sentence.A screen in game allows to configure player preferences, access a Compendium of infos and the selection of the perks.
chapter.1.quest.19.subtitle: Keeps safe your inventory items on death with many features for better survivability and exploration
chapter.1.quest.19.title: Corail's Tombstones
chapter.1.quest.2.description.1:
- Piglins now have a reputation system that works similarly to Villagers. Doing things like fighting alongside them against Wither mobs, giving them gifts and bartering with them increases your reputation. Doing things like hurting or killing Piglin mobs and engaging in unauthorized mining/chest opening around them decreases your reputation.


- At +50 reputation with a Piglin, you will no longer be required to wear gold armor around them. At +100 reputation, you will be authorized to open chests and mine gold around them.


- At -50 reputation with a Piglin, you will no longer receive items from bartering. At -100 reputation, you will be attacked on sight regardless of whether or not you are wearing gold armor.


- Piglins seek out and pick up food items (by default, porkchops and cooked porkchops) and consume them, complete with an eating animation. Players can also right-click them with their food items if the Piglin has not already recently eaten and they will accept it. Eating food will also restore a Piglin's health in an amount identical to the food item's hunger value.


- Piglins can now barter with gold nuggets and gold blocks. Gold nuggets make you far more likely to receive common barter items, with all item stack sizes halved. Gold blocks make you far more likely to receive rare barter items, with all item stack sizes doubled.


- Piglins now shake their heads like Villagers when declining an offered item.


 Piglins now emit particles/make sounds when accepting an item from you or declining it.
chapter.1.quest.2.task.1.title: New Piglins Behavior
chapter.1.quest.20.subtitle: Move your mouse to the left side to open quest menu!
chapter.1.quest.20.task.1.title: MORE QUESTS ARE WAITING!
chapter.1.quest.21.description.1:
Project MMO adds stats that level up while doing certain activities.


You can access the Project MMO menu with the Open Menu key (Default: P). Here you can see stats, skills and their benefits, how to get experience, and much more.


Higher skill levels gives you bonuses related to the skill, and allows you to use more items.


Certain items will grant a boost to Skill XP gain, when either held in your hands or worn.


Some biomes and dimensions also adjust Skill XP gain, information like this can be found in the Glossary as well.


You can create a party with the "/pmmo party" command, which gives increased XP gain, reduced friendly fire, and minor Skill XP sharing.
chapter.1.quest.21.subtitle: (brief explanation about stats)
chapter.1.quest.21.task.1.title: Project MMO
chapter.1.quest.21.title: Character progression and skills
chapter.1.quest.22.description.1:
Alchemy experience is gained by crafting brewing ingredients and brewing potions in a brewing stand.


Higher levels increase the chance for extra potions to be brewed.
chapter.1.quest.22.task.1.title: Alchemy
chapter.1.quest.23.description.1:
Agility experience is gained from multiple sources related to movement.


- Sprinting: the faster you are going, the more experience you gain.


- Jumping: the higher you jump the more experience you gain.


- Being saved from fall damage by this skill


Higher levels will increase the chance to prevent fall damage.
chapter.1.quest.23.task.1.title: Agility
chapter.1.quest.24.description.1:
Swimming experience. Yep.


Reaching level 25 will unlock underwater night vision.
chapter.1.quest.24.task.1.title: Swimming
chapter.1.quest.25.description.1:
Flying experience is gained during Elytra flight.


Higher levels do not give any bonuses.
chapter.1.quest.25.task.1.title: Flying
chapter.1.quest.26.description.1:
Endurance experience is gained by taking damage.


Higher levels will increase damage reduction and max health.
chapter.1.quest.26.task.1.title: Endurance
chapter.1.quest.27.description.1:
Combat experience is gained by attacking mobs.


Less experience is gained if the mob dies, or is one-shot from full health.


Higher levels increase melee damage.
chapter.1.quest.27.task.1.title: Combat
chapter.1.quest.28.description.1:
Archery experience is gained by attacking mobs with ranged weapons.


More experience is gained if the mob dies, is one-shot from full health, and if the distance was more than 16 blocks.


Higher levels increase ranged damage.


NOTICE: Experience gain has issues, and we can't fix it on our end.
chapter.1.quest.28.task.1.title: Archery
chapter.1.quest.29.description.1:
Excavation experience is gained by digging blocks like dirt, sand and snow.


Higher levels allow you to dig faster and to find treasure when digging.
chapter.1.quest.29.task.1.title: Excavation
chapter.1.quest.3.description.1:
Nether portals now come in the form of Dimensional Rifts, which you'll find scattered deep underground. You'll have to find one of these Rifts in order to get to the Nether - but be careful, because it's now a one-way trip!


To get back from the Nether, you'll have to search for a Monolith. These are new, semi-rare structures that can be easily spotted from far away thanks to the beams they shoot into the sky.


The block at the center of each Monolith that shoots this beam is called a Reclaimer, and it's the key to returning to the Overworld. However, the Reclaimer won't do much without a little power. In order to power it, you'll have to place a gold block on each of its four sides - something that shouldn't be too difficult to pull off in the Nether. 


Once powered, the Reclaimer has the ability to lift you back into the Overworld.
=================================
 You can bucket the Dimensional Plasma from a Dimensional Rift to bring it closer to your base, and you can mine the Reclaimer from a Monolith and place it right by where your Plasma teleports you to in the Nether.


So, it's pretty close to a two-way portal, the only real difference being you'll have to find a Dimensional Rift and a Monolith first.
chapter.1.quest.3.task.1.title: New nether portal mechanics
chapter.1.quest.30.description.1:
Mining experience is gained by breaking stone-based blocks.


Higher levels allow you to mine faster and mine extra ore.
chapter.1.quest.30.task.1.title: Mining
chapter.1.quest.31.description.1:
Woodcutting experience is gained by breaking wood blocks (logs, planks, etc.).


Higher levels allow you to chop faster and sometimes chop extra wood.
chapter.1.quest.31.task.1.title: Woodcutting
chapter.1.quest.32.description.1:
Farming experience is gained from crops maturing, harvesting certain crops, and breeding animals.


Higher levels increase harvest size and growth speed.
chapter.1.quest.32.task.1.title: Farming
chapter.1.quest.33.description.1:
You'll never guess what Fishing experience is gained from. That's right, fishing. Craziest thing.


Higher levels increase the chance of catching better items and enchantments.


You can see detailed info on this in the Glossary.
chapter.1.quest.33.task.1.title: Fishing
chapter.1.quest.34.description.1:
Magic experience is gained by mining magical ores, reading tomes, and casting spells.


Higher levels grant increased maximum mana, mana regeneration, and magic damage.


NOTICE: Experience gain has issues, and we can't fix it on our end.
chapter.1.quest.34.task.1.title: Magic
chapter.1.quest.35.description.1:
Smithing experience is gained from repairing items in an anvil and salvaging items at a smithing table (sneak-use).


Higher levels give multiple benefits.


- Bonus ores smelted
- Increased salvage success rate
- Increased repair amount in anvil
- Reduced chance of anvil damage
chapter.1.quest.35.task.1.title: Smithing
chapter.1.quest.36.description.1:
Waystones allows players to return to them once they've been activated, either through a Warp Scroll, a Warp Stone, or another waystone.


You can find some in the wild, in towers, and in villages.


You can also buy one in the shop and put it wherever you want.
chapter.1.quest.36.task.1.title: Find a waystone
chapter.1.quest.36.title: Waystones
chapter.1.quest.37.description.1:
Gathering skill is the sum of your Mining, Woodcutting and Excavating experience.


Higher levels allow you to equip and use higher quality items.
chapter.1.quest.37.task.1.title: Gathering
chapter.1.quest.38.description.1: Eterna is the stat that controls what level your enchanting table is at.  Certain types of bookshelves are only capable of providing certain max levels of Eterna, so be sure to check the max on the block.
chapter.1.quest.38.task.1.title: Eterna
chapter.1.quest.38.title: Eterna
chapter.1.quest.39.description.1:
Quanta determines how much flux is in your enchanting process.  When you begin an enchantment process, after spending your experience, your Quanta level will work behind the scenes to change your enchantment level.


This is not always beneficial, as Quanta is capable of both increasing and decreasing the actual enchanting level.


With a lot of Quanta, and a little luck, you could technically receive an enchantment equal to spending 200 levels!
chapter.1.quest.39.task.1.title: Quanta
chapter.1.quest.4.description.1:
Blood Moon:
- Increases monster spawn cap and prevents sleeping.


Harvest Moon:
Increases crop growth rate and drop rate.


Blue Moon:
Gives players the Luck effect, increasing some loot quality and fishing loot.


Sometimes a super version of lunar events occurs that has an amplified effect.
chapter.1.quest.4.task.1.title: New Lunar events
chapter.1.quest.40.description.1:
Arcana determines how hard it is to get rare enchantments.  At 0%, the base rules for enchantment rarity apply, but as your Arcana increases, rare enchantments will become more common, and common enchantments will become quite rare.


At 100% Arcana, the rarities are flipped on their heads entirely, and Very Rare enchantments will show up at the rate of common enchantments, while Common enchantments will be hard to find!  Finally, at 25% and 75% Arcana, every time you enchant, you are guaranteed an extra enchantment.
chapter.1.quest.40.task.1.title: Arcana
chapter.1.quest.40.title: Arcana
chapter.1.quest.41.description.1: You can choose starter gear in the Specialization chapter. You can get Marks which can boost pmmo exp, however you cannot change your specialization. If you are in multiplayer you should pick your specialization before joining a team.
chapter.1.quest.41.task.1.title: Choose a Specialization
chapter.1.quest.41.title: Specialization
chapter.1.quest.42.description.1:
Wall Cling: Jump towards a wall and hold the Wall Jump / Cling keybind (Default: Left Shift).


Wall Jump: While wall clinging, keep holding W and let go of the keybind to wall jump


You can chain together wall jumps to go as high as you want!
chapter.1.quest.42.subtitle: Even more new movement features!
chapter.1.quest.42.task.1.title: Wall-Jump!
chapter.1.quest.43.description.1:
These skills do not have bonuses like the others, but are used solely for item requirements.


Dragonslayer is gained from... slaying dragons.


Shadow is gained from killing certain mobs (see Glossary's Mobs Info section) and crafting Eidolon items.


Light is gained from killing certain mobs (see Glossary's Mobs Info section).


Wayfaring is gained from exploring new structures and areas.


Dungeoneering is gained from crafting and mining dungeon related items and blocks.
chapter.1.quest.43.subtitle: Dragonslayer, Shadow, Light, Wayfaring, Dungeoneering
chapter.1.quest.43.task.1.title: Other Skills
chapter.1.quest.44.description.1:
Mobs now have a chance to spawn as Champions, elite mobs with enhanced stats, extra abilities, and extra loot (Enchanted Books and Coins).


Champions have affixes that grant them powers, with higher tiers having more affixes.


There are currently 6 tiers of Champions, locked behind game stages.


- Tier 1 and 2: Always Spawn
- Tier 3, 4, 5 and 6: Master Mode


For information on what coins which tiers drop, check out the Coin Shop!
chapter.1.quest.44.subtitle: Elite Mobs
chapter.1.quest.44.task.1.title: Champions
chapter.1.quest.45.description.1:
There are multiple methods to perform disenchanting.


Cobwebs can be used in an anvil to remove non-curse enchantments.


Prismatic Cobwebs can be used in an anvil to remove curse enchantments.


Book of Disenchantment can be used with a Grave Soul to strip multiple enchantments from items (not books), into individual books. Knowledge of Death perks can increase the amount extracted.


Tome of Hungering Knowledge crafts together with an enchanted item to transfer all enchantments to one book.


Tome of Scrapping is the only method that destroys the item, and it only takes some enchantments.
chapter.1.quest.45.task.1.title: Disenchanting
chapter.1.quest.5.description.1:
• Atum 2 - a new and unique desert dimension full of sand, temples, as well as many new enemies! Traveling through the dimension you can discover new artifacts, making your way to them through mountains of sand and enemies.


• Blue skies: Everbright and Everdawn - two new dimensions, one lighter and colder, and the other darker and warmer. In each of them you will find new blocks, mobs, tools, weapons and bosses.


• Dimensional Dungeons - limitless procedurally generated dungeons dimension.


• The Bumblezone - an unBEElievable dimension full of bees that become REALLY angry if you take their honey!


• Tropicraft - dimension adding tropical world


• Twilight forest - a realm basked in mystery and eerie twilight.


• Undergarden - a dark, subterranean world located deep below the bedrock of the Overworld. The flora here has adapted to their conditions and can grow anywhere, independent of light. Strange creatures call these dark lands home, and are plagued by the invasive Rotspawn, monsters originating from a chaotic, mysterious realm.
chapter.1.quest.5.subtitle: Current dimensions count: 10
chapter.1.quest.5.task.1.title: New dimensions!
chapter.1.quest.6.description.1:
The blue/gray feather icons above your hunger indicate your Dodge Meter.


Every armor has a weight that affects your maximum dodges. Gray feathers indicate armor weight.


The Lightweight enchantment can decrease armor weight, granting you feathers back.


You can dash by holding any direction and pressing the Dodge keybind (Default: Left Alt).
chapter.1.quest.6.subtitle: In-Depth, Well Balanced and Seamlessly Integrated Dodging
chapter.1.quest.6.task.1.title: Dodge
chapter.1.quest.7.description.1:
There is now a new system for enchanting that uses three stats, instead of the original single stat system.


To support the new enchantment stat system, Apotheosis adds 11 new bookshelves, each with their own unique enchanting stat combinations.  Shown here are the Endshelves, Seashelves, Hellshelves, the Beeshelf and the Melonshelf.  Combinations of these shelves can allow for any stat values you could dream of, however, reaching significantly high Eterna levels requires Endshelves.
chapter.1.quest.7.task.1.title: New Enchanting mechanics
chapter.1.quest.7.title: New Enchantment system by Apotheosis
chapter.1.quest.8.description.1:
- underground and flying villages
- overhauled mineshaft, strongholds, dungeons, caves
chapter.1.quest.8.task.1.title: New structures!
chapter.1.quest.8.title: New and overhauled structures!
chapter.1.quest.9.description.1:
Damage from sharp objects, bites, and cactuses will cause entities to bleed.


Bleeding causes damage over time, like poison, and is lethal. Bandages can cure bleeding and provide regeneration.


Each piece of armor equipped reduces bleed chance by 10%.


In Expert and Master Mode, the level of Bleeding is increased.
chapter.1.quest.9.task.1.title: Bleeding
chapter.1.title: Features | mechanics
chapter.10.quest.1.description.1:
Dimensional Dungeons adds limitless procedurally generated dungeons to Minecraft! These dungeons are all placed in a single, separate dimension which can be accessed from a portal anywhere on the Overworld. This makes the dungeons themselves renewable and it provides challenging, replayable content.


The dungeon dimension limits building and block breaking. This allows for a proper adventure mode-like experience




Besides challenges in room design the dungeons are also randomly populated with enemies and worthwhile loot! Many rooms with valuable treasure chests require solving a puzzle that will test your knowledge of Minecraft game mechanics.
chapter.10.quest.2.description.1: Blank Portal Keys are crafted from a Blaze Rod and a Name Tag. You may want several.
chapter.10.quest.3.description.1: First craft three Gilded Portal Blocks, which are a Chiseled Stone Brick surrounded by 8 Gold Ingots.
chapter.10.quest.4.description.1: Second, combine one of your three Gilded Portal Blocks with the Trapped Chest and the Eye of Ender to form a Portal Keyhole Block.
chapter.10.quest.5.description.1:
A blank key cannot be used to enter a dungeon. A newly crafted key must first be used in an 'activation ritual' which will inscribe the name and location of a randomly generated dungeon onto the key. This action will require you to bring the key to a fitting location on The Overworld.


Basically, find a Stronghold, and use the key on the top of an End Portal Frame. You must aim for the black square on top.


Go back to your portal frame and place the key in the keyhole. If everything is correct then a golden dungeon portal should appear. If the frame was not built correctly then the portal will shatter immediately.


Keys can only be written to once. However keys are absolutely reusable! If you find a dungeon that is worth visiting more than once be sure to save that key somewhere in your base. A named key will always consistently take you back to the same dungeon.
chapter.10.quest.5.title: Activating Portal Keys
chapter.10.quest.6.description.1:
First, here is a minimum raw materials list:
- 9x Stone Bricks
- 3x Chiseled Stone Bricks
- 24x Gold Ingots
- 1x Trapped Chest
- 1x Eye of Ender


Keep in mind you will also need to craft and activate keys. This is only the first step.
chapter.10.quest.6.task.1.title: Creating the Basic Portal
chapter.10.quest.7.description.1: Basically you need a frame of Stone Bricks surrounding two air blocks. And replace the top center block with the Portal Keyhole Block. The two spires on the side need to have your two remaining Gilded Portal BLocks on top.
chapter.10.quest.7.description.2:
Sinking the portal into the ground is a good idea so that you don't have to jump into it. But remember you still need to place the Stone Bricks on the bottom even if you can't see them!


Other Stone Brick variants can be used in the build, too. And the only air blocks that matter are the two blocks where the portal will appear.
chapter.10.quest.7.task.1.title: Valid Portal Builds
chapter.10.quest.8.subtitle: Activate portal key
chapter.10.quest.9.description.1:
Advanced dungeons are exactly what they sound like. Bigger layouts, tougher monsters, and improved loot!


While exploring basic dungeons you might find a Portal Keystone Block with an item in it. Take it! The item inside should be an advanced key, with a different naming convention and a different color. This is the only way to obtain advanced dungeon keys. They must be found!


Your basic portal frame is not powerful enough to handle these legendary new portal keys! You must enhance your basic portal with additional blocks.


First, you must hang two colorful banners, one on each spire. The banners should be white/purple with either color as the base. For reference, match the filled keyhole itself.


Second you must place two Portal Crown Blocks on top of your portal frame. You're going to have to rely on finding Portal Crown Blocks as loot in basic dungeon chests.
chapter.10.quest.9.subtitle: Find two portal crown blocks
chapter.10.subtitle: Limitless adventure from a single portal that you can build anywhere!
chapter.10.title: Dimensional Travels
chapter.11.quest.1.description.1:
To create the Atum Portal, build a 5x5 floor layer, then add another layer, keep a 3x3 area clear on the top layer and fill each with a water source block.


Each corner must have a 2 high pillar.


The throw a Scarab into the water to activate the portal.


Every block on the portal MUST be made of vanilla sandstone.
chapter.11.quest.1.subtitle: Enter Atum dimension
chapter.11.quest.1.title: Atum 2: Return to the Sands
chapter.11.quest.100.description.1: Used to craft a variety of items. The two most interesting being the Godforged blocks and the Torches of the Gods.
chapter.11.quest.100.subtitle: Shatter their influience
chapter.11.quest.100.task.1.title: Any #atum:godshards
chapter.11.quest.100.title: Fragments of Godly Power
chapter.11.quest.101.description.1:
These blocks allow one to randomly gain a new Godforged item.


The Deity of the item is determined by the type of block, with the normal Godforged block dropping any of the Godforged items


To do this simply place the Godforged block and then break it with the Nebu Hammer. Once broken you will gain a new Godforged item.
chapter.11.quest.101.subtitle: Remake that which was Broken
chapter.11.quest.102.description.1: When used in place of the standard Nebu torches these will influence the type of Godforged item dropped by the awakened pharaoh to match that of the torches used.
chapter.11.quest.102.subtitle: Invoke the Gods
chapter.11.quest.102.title: Torches of the Gods
chapter.11.quest.103.description.1: These sealed structures resist all normal attempts at entry. Placing Nebu torches on these Quandary Blocks near the entrance will break the ancient seal.
chapter.11.quest.103.subtitle: Long Since Forgotten
chapter.11.quest.103.task.1.title: Find a Pyramid
chapter.11.quest.103.task.3.title: Observer Quandary Block
chapter.11.quest.103.title: Desert Secrets
chapter.11.quest.104.description.1: Like entering the pyramid placing Nebu Torches on the Quandary blocks will break the seal and allow you to open the Sarcophagus.
chapter.11.quest.104.subtitle: Shut Tight, Something Stirs
chapter.11.quest.104.task.1.title: Observe the Sarcophagus
chapter.11.quest.105.description.1:
These relics need to be washed. To do so drop them carefully into water. (This also works dropping into a cauldron of water.)


Sometimes you may randomly fumble while washing them off and the item will be destroyed.
chapter.11.quest.105.subtitle: Ancient Relics with a Glimmer Beneath
chapter.11.quest.105.title: Buried in the Sands
chapter.11.quest.11.description.1:
With the Godforge and Nebu hammer you can recycle unwanted Godforged items.


Simply fill the forge with lava and place any Godforged item into the forge and it will melt down to the corresponding shard.
chapter.11.quest.11.subtitle: Forge of the Gods
chapter.11.quest.8.description.1: This block has no GUI. To operate click on it with the input then continue clicking to slowly grind down the item.
chapter.11.quest.9.description.1: This block has no GUI. To operate it click the top with the input ingredients and keep clicking till you see the side texture change. Once the side texture changes you can click the side to get the output.
chapter.11.quest.99.description.1: Collect all the fragments of bygone power.
chapter.11.quest.99.title: Shard Collector
chapter.11.subtitle: Atum 2
chapter.11.title: Into the sands
chapter.12.quest.1.description.1:
Find the Gatekeeper and trade a book in exchange for his journal. You can find the houses spawning in either plains, mountains, and most snowy biomes.


The Blue Journal, a book written by the Gatekeeper that’s filled with information discovered from his experiences in these dimensions. The more you progress through Blue Skies, the more pages you will unlock in the journal. You only need to obtain the blue journal item once. Afterwards, you can always find access to it by opening your inventory and clicking the tab on the right with the blue journal icon.
chapter.12.quest.11.description.1: Can be used to craft a moonstone, which emits light.
chapter.12.quest.12.description.1: Can be used as a method of teleportation.
chapter.12.quest.13.description.1: Unlike in the overworld some blue skies mobs can spawn in light. This block will help prevent that.
chapter.12.quest.13.subtitle: Keep the monsters at bay with this cool lantern!
chapter.12.quest.14.description.1: Needed to light both the everbright and everdawn portals. Creates blue fire when used in the everbright, and black fire when in the everdawn.
chapter.12.quest.17.description.1: The Tool Box can be used to change a blue skies tool's rod, and grant it bonus durability with a falsite ingot.
chapter.12.quest.17.subtitle: Keeping your tools well repaired
chapter.12.quest.18.description.1: This table can be used to combine any 5 foods (even ones not from blue skies) into one. Most foods will also keep their effects when converted into the meal.
chapter.12.quest.2.description.1: The Everbright is a realm of eternal day and frigid cold. Home to large beasts and ethereal mobs, you’ll need to keep an eye on your back as you traverse through this world. Be sure to watch out for snow storms that bring thick fog and more enemies than usual. As you explore, you’ll encounter the Summoner’s Blinding Dungeon and the new Nature Dungeon, home of the Starlit Crusher.
chapter.12.quest.2.reward.3.title: 50 Light XP
chapter.12.quest.2.subtitle: Find an Everbright portal and enter it
chapter.12.quest.2.title: Visit Dimension: Everbright
chapter.12.quest.21.description.1: Both the everbright and everdawn need four of these to access their tower illager boss. Can't find all four? Here's a hint: check the brewing stands!
chapter.12.quest.27.subtitle: I recommend getting a blue skies axe and spear before fighting this living tree, or you are going to have a bad time...
chapter.12.quest.3.description.1: The Everdawn has its sun forever rising. With this being a much more humid and warm world, insects and reptiles flourish. Before entering, it’s worth preparing for poison and fire as many parts of this world may inflict those on you. Venture across this diverse landscape to uncover the Alchemist’s Blinding Dungeon and then the new Poison Dungeon, lair of the Arachnarch.
chapter.12.quest.3.reward.3.title: 50 Shadow XP
chapter.12.quest.3.subtitle: Find an Everdawn portal and enter it
chapter.12.quest.3.title: Visit Dimension: Everdawn
chapter.12.quest.4.description.1: While you can't craft tools with this, you can use it to craft buckets, shears, anvils and most importantly, the tool box!
chapter.12.quest.41.subtitle: Enter a Nature dungeon
chapter.12.quest.42.subtitle: Enter a Poison dungeon
chapter.12.quest.43.subtitle: Use an Alchemy table
chapter.12.quest.45.subtitle: Use a summoning table to summon artificial golem
chapter.12.quest.46.description.1: Used to summon your own minions
chapter.12.quest.47.description.1: Used to convert blocks into similar blocks. Useful for changing the color of certain items like wool and dragon scales.
chapter.12.quest.48.description.1: Grants a speed boost when worn in the arcs section. This is not a curio.
chapter.12.quest.49.description.1: Grants invisibility while sneaking when worn in the arcs section. This is not a curio.
chapter.12.quest.5.description.1: In addition to its crafting uses, Falsite is used to grant tools bonus durability
chapter.12.quest.50.description.1: A Spear that comes back to you when thrown.
chapter.12.quest.51.description.1: A shield that can also be used as a weapon in the mainhand.
chapter.12.quest.53.description.1: This one grants regeneration when eaten. Grow it by planting standard brewberries on cherry grass.
chapter.12.quest.55.description.1: Tools, Weapons and Armor outside the blue skies dimensions will be weaker when in them. You will want to make gear from the dimensions to help you progress.
chapter.12.quest.55.task.1.title: New Beginnings
chapter.12.quest.56.description.1:
Blue skies tools will be slightly different based on what stick you use in its recipe. Some give more durability while others give more attack speed. The Tool Box can be used to change the rod whenever you want.


Spears from Blue Skies are throwable and are your main source of ranged attacks while in either of these dimensions. They also make a boss much easier later on.


Try crafting blue skies tools and spears with these sticks and notice the change in durability and attack speed.
chapter.12.quest.56.task.1.title: Any #blue_skies:tools
chapter.12.quest.56.title: Sticks and Spears
chapter.12.quest.6.description.1: Used to craft the horizonite forge, and make tools with autosmelt.
chapter.12.quest.60.description.1: Remember that stone mining quest back in the overworld chapter? Now do it here!
chapter.12.quest.60.title: Break 640x Turquoise Stone and Lunar Stone
chapter.12.quest.61.reward.2.title: 150 Alchemy XP
chapter.12.quest.61.subtitle: I wouldn't really call summoning rocks "alchemy"
chapter.12.quest.62.reward.2.title: 150 Endurance XP
chapter.12.quest.63.description.1: A Furnace that runs on snowcaps.
chapter.12.quest.64.description.1: Increases your melee damage while you are poisoned.
chapter.12.quest.64.reward.1.title: 300 Shadow XP
chapter.12.quest.65.description.1: Gives you special green hearts that regnerate over time.
chapter.12.quest.65.reward.1.title: 300 Light XP
chapter.12.quest.68.description.1:
These Spears can be enchanted with Piercing as well as Loyalty, making them like a trident that's good for dealing with multiple mobs at once.


To make them more relevant in this modpack there are enchanting table infusion enchanting recipes that allow you to enchant them with damage upgrades like Wrath which cannot be normally put on the spears.
chapter.12.quest.68.task.1.title: Spear Enchanting
chapter.12.quest.68.title: Spear Enchanting
chapter.12.quest.7.description.1: Diopside has higher damage and armor toughness than charoite, but lower attack speed and armor.
chapter.12.title: Blue Skies
chapter.13.quest.1.subtitle: Enter the mysterious magical woodlands; the Twilight Forest.
chapter.13.quest.10.description.1:
When the Hydra, Ur-Ghast and Snow Queen have been defeated, the Highlands will unlock, revealing the final stages in progression. If entered before defeating all three bosses, the player will be damaged by acid rain.


Unlike previous stages, the Highlands does not have a boss to defeat, rather an item to obtain to get to the center. This area is split into two: the Troll Cave and the Cloud Cottage. To complete this achievement, the player must obtain the Lamp of Cinders from inside an Obsidian vault, requiring a Giant's Pickaxe to break in. Once the Lamp is acquired, the player can move on to the next stage.
chapter.13.quest.10.subtitle: Slay the Hydra, Ur-Ghast, and Snow Queen to clear the acid rain and embolden yourself for the Highlands.
chapter.13.quest.15.description.1: The Thornlands stage is the final functioning stage in Twilight Forest. It is completed by simply burning through the dense bushes of Thorns with a Lamp of Cinders. This allows the player to move onto the final stage of progression.
chapter.13.quest.19.description.1: You need to eat this to advance to the fire swamps.
chapter.13.quest.2.description.1: The Naga can be found in the Naga Courtyard. When killed it drops Naga Scales and a Naga Trophy along with some other loot; touching a scale will allow the player to enter the Lich Tower.
chapter.13.quest.2.subtitle: Slay the Naga in its forest courtyard and obtain a Naga Scale to overcome the barrier magic surrounding the Lich's tower.
chapter.13.quest.3.description.1:
The Twilight Lich can be found in the Lich Tower. Killing it and getting a scepter will allow the player to enter the Swamp, Dark Forest, and Snowy Forest as well as the dungeons in each area.


The next stage in Twilight Forest progression is the Twilight Swamp. The Twilight Lich must be defeated and its Scepter taken before entering this phase. Entering this stage before the Twilight Lich is defeated will inflict Hunger on the player.
chapter.13.quest.3.subtitle: Slay the Twilight Lich at top of his tower and retrieve a Scepter to clear poisonous mosquitoes from the Swamp, see through blinding darkness of the Dark Forest's curse, and resist the Snowy Forest's chill.
chapter.13.quest.3.title: Twilight Lich Trophy
chapter.13.quest.38.description.1: The Questing Ram is a friendly boss animal added by Twilight Forest. He is found in the Quest Grove, which can only be found in the Enchanted Forest biome. Unlike other bosses, this animal is not meant to be slain. Instead, the player is supposed to complete his Quest of giving it Wool in every color. Wool can be given to him by dropping the Wool under the Ram, or by using the Wool on him. Each time a block of Wool is given his body will elongate and a stripe of that color wool will be added to his body.
chapter.13.quest.4.description.1: The Minoshroom can be found in Labyrinths, which are found in the Twilight Swamp biome. Natural entrances can be found through caves or the small hills found in the surface that lead directly to the center. The goal of this dungeon is to kill the Minoshroom. Killing it and eating one of the dropped Meef Stroganoff will allow the player to enter the Fire Swamp.
chapter.13.quest.4.subtitle: The meat and mushroom stew pleasantly warms you, enough so you feel you're acclimatised enough to venture into the Fire Swamp.
chapter.13.quest.4.title: Minoshroom Trophy
chapter.13.quest.42.subtitle: Hunt some of the local wildlife.
chapter.13.quest.5.description.1:
The Hydra can be found in the Hydra Lair in the middle of a Fire Swamp. Killing it and obtaining Fiery Blood from it will complete one step to unlocking the Highlands.


The next stage in Twilight Forest progression is the Dark Forest biome. Added to its already extreme darkness, players will have Blindness inflicted on them unless they have defeated the Twilight Lich first. This can be circumvented if the player is wearing a helmet enchanted with Night Vision.
chapter.13.quest.5.subtitle: Defeat the mighty Hydra and empower yourself.
chapter.13.quest.6.description.1: The Knight Phantom can be found in the Goblin Knight Stronghold underneath Dark Forests. Before being able to enter the stronghold, the player must find a room with a Trophy Pedestal. On the pedestal, they must place any trophy. When placed down the shield around the stronghold will be removed.The player then needs to go through the stronghold until the Knight Phantom is found. When killed it will allow access to the Dark Tower.
chapter.13.quest.6.subtitle: Settle the restless phantoms in the Knight's Tomb and the carminite tower's devices will obey you.
chapter.13.quest.63.description.1: Get your axes and shears ready! Search every nook and cranny and get anything and everything that comes from trees! Craft, loot, obtain every slab... sapling... leaves... more... everything. ALL OF IT!
chapter.13.quest.66.description.1: Watch the final boss spawner as it spawns nothing. You... win?
chapter.13.quest.66.reward.5.title: Final Boss Title
chapter.13.quest.66.subtitle: "Final Boss When?" -literally every new twilight forest user
chapter.13.quest.66.task.1.title: Look at final boss spawner
chapter.13.quest.66.title: The Unfinished Forest
chapter.13.quest.7.description.1:
The Ur-Ghast can be found in the Dark Tower found in the middle of the Dark Forest. It is found at the top of the tower, along with many other monsters, such as Carminite Ghastlings, Towerwood Borers, and Carminite Golems. Killing it and taking the Fiery Tears will complete one step to unlocking the Highlands.


The next stage in Twilight Forest progression is in the Snowy Forest and Glacier biomes. If entered before defeating the Twilight Lich, the player will freeze and move much slower than in other biomes.
chapter.13.quest.7.subtitle: Touch the fiery red tears of the Ur-Ghast.
chapter.13.quest.8.description.1: The Alpha Yeti is found in the Yeti Lair, in the center of Snowy Forest biomes. There are four natural entrances. Inside the lair are many Yeti packs. Killing the Alpha Yeti and obtaining the Alpha Yeti Fur will unlock the Glacier biome.
chapter.13.quest.8.subtitle: Line your garments with the soft fur from the Alpha Yeti, keeping you safe from the Glacier's cold.
chapter.13.quest.9.description.1: The Snow Queen is found in the Aurora Palace, located in Glacier biomes. When conquered, the player will complete one step to unlocking the Highlands.
chapter.13.quest.9.subtitle: Defeat the Snow Queen atop the Aurora Palace.
chapter.13.title: Twilight zone
chapter.14.quest.1.description.1: The method to leave this dimension is the same way you got in, a portal will NOT spawn.
chapter.14.quest.1.subtitle: Why bother with quests? Just chill...
chapter.14.quest.2.description.1:
Make yourself a drink, Get a chair sit down and watch the sunset


You've earned it.

chapter.17.quest.1.description.1:
The Bumblezone is a dimension filled with Honeycomb Blocks, Honey Blocks, Honey Crystals, Sugar Water, and few new bee-related Blocks! There's even a structure with unique bee armor you can obtain!




 Entering the dimension is super easy! Just throw an Enderpearl at any Bee Nest or Beehive (even modded ones works!) to enter inside it and spawn into the dimension. You can also make yourself (riding a mob or vehicle) or any mob enter the dimension by using a piston to push the player or mob into a Beehive or Bee Nest block!


To teleport out of the dimension, you can either dig down and fall below Y = 0 or climb your way to above Y = 256.
chapter.17.quest.1.title: ♪ Highway to the Bumble Zone ♫
chapter.17.quest.8.subtitle: Tame a Behemoth with buckets of honey
chapter.17.quest.9.subtitle: Infused a Slime with honey

Easiest way to get this is through ars break + extract or a silk touch pick.

chapter.18.quest.4.description.1:
This is found in the Overworld, the Nether, and the End.

chapter.18.quest.8.description.1:

Made in the Overworld or the Nether.


Made from blaze rods and a netherite ingot.

chapter.19.quest.1.description.1:
Tired of those boring old beds at your base.


Upgrade to a strange bed by finding some special mushrooms.


The best place to find them is within the nether.

chapter.19.quest.1.title: Sweet Dreams

Are you dreaming or is this reality who knows.

chapter.20.quest.1.description.1:
This will allow you to start creating a number of drinks. By right clicking on this with a variety of grown products the process can begin.
The brewing barrel will bubble while working, but when this stops right clicking with an empty glass bottle will give you your new treat.
The following quests give you some drinks to try.


Specific alcohol beverages will grant unique effects when consumed. However, when consumed too much, a random negative effect will be placed on the player.
Potential random negative effects: Weakness, Blindness, Wither, Mining fatigue, Hunger, Poison, Unluck
chapter.20.quest.100.description.1: Incurs a 50% chance to not use durability when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.101.description.1: Incurs a 50% chance to not use durability when applied to a rod, as well as increase the rods luck.
chapter.20.quest.102.description.1: Is placed on the ground with a rightclick. From there, you can access it's inventory where you can apply tackle to fishing rods on the right. The box also has storage slots to hold bait and tackle. To pickup the box again simply shift rightclick it.
chapter.20.quest.103.description.1: Incurs a 20% chance to not use durability when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.104.description.1: Can be dyed like leather and can be used to customize your fishing rod.
chapter.20.quest.105.description.1: Increases a rods luck when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.107.description.1: I caught a chest..... wonder if it is anything valuable?
chapter.20.quest.108.description.1: When you just want to blind the fish.
chapter.20.quest.109.description.1: The best fishing rod around. Neptune's personal rod. Increases bite rate of fish.

chapter.20.quest.133.description.1: Using a Knife on grassy plants will yield Straw, a useful building and composting material. Early on, it's best used to craft some Ropes.
chapter.20.quest.135.subtitle: Can be used as a replacement for Leather
chapter.20.quest.137.description.1:
Ropes are essentially reverse scaffolding: the can be continuously deployed downward from the same spot, and can be climbed without collision. This allows players to safely descend or ascend high altitudes, such as ravines or mountains.


When placing Rope, you can use more ropes against the first one to deploy them downward. This will continuously extend a column of rope down to the bottom-most Y-level possible, allowing for easy and controllable descents into chasms, ravines or from high locations.


To suppress rope deployment, simply sneak while placing it. If there's no space underneath to deploy, it will also place normally.
chapter.20.quest.14.subtitle: Absorption
chapter.20.quest.140.description.1:
Baskets can be placed facing any of the six cardinal directions, and will even work upside down. Items colliding with its open face will be captured and stored in its inventory.


It has the same inventory size as a Chest or Barrel, but lacks the ability to actively transfer items between blocks, such as extracting from, or inserting into, adjacent inventories. Other item-transferring blocks can interact with a Basket normally.
chapter.20.quest.140.subtitle: Container block that can capture dropped items through its open side, like a Hopper.
chapter.20.quest.141.description.1:
When any growable plant is placed on Rich Soil, its growth will be randomly boosted, similar to the usage of Bone Meal.
Rich Soil can be tilled into Rich Farmland through the use of hoes. Rich Farmland is immune to mob trampling and won't unravel to Melons or Pumpkins, but requires hydration in order to boost crops.


Mushrooms planted on Rich Soil under sufficient darkness will eventually form a Mushroom Colony. Such colonies will grow from 2 to 5 mushroom caps over time, dropping them when harvested.
chapter.20.quest.141.subtitle: Enhanced type of dirt, more fertile and durable to the elements.
chapter.20.quest.142.description.1: Fully absorbs your fall without dealing damage.
chapter.20.quest.145.description.1: Also prevent the crop from being trampled
chapter.20.quest.145.subtitle: Can support any plant or crop without the need of water, useful for nether farms
chapter.20.quest.15.title: Potato
chapter.20.quest.16.subtitle: Resistance
chapter.20.quest.17.description.1: Grapes will grow into a small bush that must then have a fence piece attached to the upper bush piece to grow grapes.
chapter.20.quest.17.task.2.title: Fence
chapter.20.quest.17.title: Grape Grower
chapter.20.quest.18.description.1: Will prevent crops from being trampled in a 10 block radius.
chapter.20.quest.3.subtitle: Strength
chapter.20.quest.5.subtitle: Jump boost
chapter.20.quest.53.description.1:
The following are your basic crops that will always be handy when you are hungry.


The quests following the initial crops give a basic recipe to help keep you fed but look to JEI for more complex and fullfilling recipes.
chapter.20.quest.53.title: Basic Farming
chapter.20.quest.54.description.1: I am supposed to beat a root?

chapter.20.quest.60.description.1: You will come across a lot of these from grass.
chapter.20.quest.61.description.1: You don't have jack on me Mr. Pumpkin!
chapter.20.quest.64.description.1: Should be able to nab some of these to get you started from a village.
chapter.20.quest.64.title: Potato, Potatoe
chapter.20.quest.65.description.1: Should be able to find a few of these in villages as well.
chapter.20.quest.65.title: Carrots
chapter.20.quest.68.description.1: The skin of the innocent..... oh boy that sounds bad.....
chapter.20.quest.69.description.1: Man I will be able to write so much stuff on this.

chapter.20.quest.70.description.1: Let those stalks reach for the sky!

chapter.20.quest.72.description.1: You are going to have to travel to the great white north to find some of these delicous berries.
chapter.20.quest.72.title: Sweet Berries
chapter.20.quest.76.title: Hell Wart
chapter.20.quest.78.description.1: Have to eat some melons to make some melons.
chapter.20.quest.82.description.1:
Fillet of fish sure sounds a lot better than eating a whole fish, scales and all.


Pretty much a sharp stick.
chapter.20.quest.84.description.1: Should be better than cutting open a fish with a sharp stick.
chapter.20.quest.9.subtitle: Regeneration
chapter.20.quest.90.description.1: A fillet knife imbuded with the power of Neptune. It will never break and gives additional fillets per fish.
chapter.20.quest.91.title: Gotta Catch Them All!
chapter.20.quest.92.description.1: Worms are but a single bait that can be used with fishing rods. Their are also leeches and minnows that you catch by fishing.
chapter.20.quest.92.title: Bait
chapter.20.quest.93.title: What is this junk?
chapter.20.quest.94.description.1: Can be dyed like leather and can be used to customize your fishing rod.
chapter.20.quest.95.description.1: The worm box works like the composter (load with vegetables or fruit) but it produces worms to use as bait.
chapter.20.quest.96.description.1: Plays a note when a fish is about to bite when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.97.description.1: Increases the amount of time allowed to reel in a fish when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.98.description.1: Allows a chance to catch two things at once when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.quest.99.description.1: Allows a rod to cast further when applied to a rod.
chapter.20.title: Farmer's Delight
chapter.21.quest.1.description.1: With this book you will be able to make food specifically from in your inventory.
chapter.21.quest.10.description.1: Holds and displays spices to be used in the kitchen.
chapter.21.quest.11.description.1: Stores and displays fruit for recipes that can be used by the kitchen.
chapter.21.quest.12.description.1: A fridge upgrade that will provide all the snow and ice you need for recipes.
chapter.21.quest.13.description.1: A fridge upgrade that saves the last item in a slot so that item spaces are saved from being replaced.
chapter.21.quest.14.description.1: By applying this upgrade to your oven it will be able to accept RF to cook food, no longer requiring fuel.
chapter.21.quest.145.title: Cakes and Pies
chapter.21.quest.15.description.1:
A hanging kitchen cabinet to decorate your kitchen and provide some extra storage.


Can be dyed to change their color.
chapter.21.quest.150.title: Sweets n` Snacks
chapter.21.quest.16.description.1:
A simple hanging cabinet corner to help around bends while maintaining connection.


Can be dyed to change their color.
chapter.21.quest.17.description.1:
Kitchen counter allows you to connect multiple pieces of kitchen equipment together as well as provide some storage for ingredients.


Can be dyed to change their color.
chapter.21.quest.18.description.1:
A simple corner to help counters around bends, maintaining their connection.


Can be dyed to change their color.
chapter.21.quest.19.description.1: The "classic" kitchen flooring. Can be converted to a number of other colors, check the recipes in JEI.
chapter.21.quest.2.description.1: This cooking table is the first step in having a entire functioning and linked kitchen. It will be where you craft your food.
chapter.21.quest.20.description.1:
Feel no need to complete a lot of these quests as they do not provide useful rewards, but are here to give you ideas on what to cook to keep your diet diverse.


May this be your veritable recipe book.
chapter.21.quest.20.subtitle: *You may need to zoom out quite a bit to see all the quests*
chapter.21.quest.20.task.1.title: Recipe Time
chapter.21.quest.3.description.1: By having a sink linked into your kitchen (touching other counter blocks and equipment) you will have water supplied freely to all your recipes.
chapter.21.quest.4.description.1: The oven will allow you to cook any food needed in your recipes, when connected in your kitchen. Without upgrades the oven will require a fuel source to cook food.
chapter.21.quest.5.description.1: The toaster will convert bread to toast for any recipe needing it.
chapter.21.quest.59.description.1: You have a straight up cafe menu with these things!
chapter.21.quest.59.title: Soup, Salad, and Casserole
chapter.21.quest.6.description.1:
Provides a constant supply of milk for recipes without manually having to be filled. 


May want to drop an anvil on a cow over a milk jar to see if one actually fits.
chapter.21.quest.60.title: Two Slices of Bread and Anything
chapter.21.quest.61.description.1: Some meals from all over the world!
chapter.21.quest.61.title: All Around the World
chapter.21.quest.63.description.1: Each type of drink will provide useful benefit
chapter.21.quest.63.title: Tea time!
chapter.21.quest.7.description.1: Holds milk to be used in recipes. Must be filled with milk manually.
chapter.21.quest.8.description.1:
The fridge is a decorative storage block that will allow you to store ingredients for recipes.
Can be double stacked to expand storage space.
chapter.21.quest.82.description.1:
The Stove is a direct upgrade to the Campfire's cooking features, and a suitable heat source for the Cooking Pot.


To add items to its grill, simply right-click the Stove when it has no objects blocking its top face. Stoves detect campfire recipes to cook, meaning they usually also take 30 seconds to fully prepare items. Stoves cannot be automated through item transferring blocks (e.g. Hoppers), but require no fuel to cook items, much like a Campfire.


Stoves can hold six (6) items on its grill, and will gently pop cooked outputs above its surface, instead of throwing them around.


Stoves can be put out using shovels or buckets of water, and reignited with Flint and Steel.
chapter.21.quest.84.description.1:
The Cooking Pot is a workstation where you can both prepare and store a large amount of meals. When placed above any suitable heat source (campfire, open flames, lava, a stove etc.), it will start bubbling, indicating it's ready to cook.


You can put up to six ingredients inside a pot. If they match, the pot will start cooking them up into a meal. Most meals need a container to be served on, such as Bowls; the result slot will tell you which one to use. Simply add the container on the corresponding slot, or right-click the pot with it, to take a serving!


Meals tend to be quite large, so they don't stack up as high in your inventory. If you're not going to eat them all right away, you can just mine the whole pot and take it with you! Cooking Pots can hold 64 servings of any meal with a container, regardless of their maximum stack limit.
chapter.21.quest.86.description.1: When consumed, it will remove a single random negative effect from the player, keeping positive ones untouched. This provides a simple use for Cocoa Beans in difficult, risky trips.
chapter.21.quest.88.description.1: This combination allows your mount to be a lot more agile during travels. Since mounts eat a large volume of feed, the item does not need to be contained in a Bowl, saving some inventory space.
chapter.21.quest.89.description.1:
Items can be placed on the Cutting Board by using them on it. It always prefers receiving items from the off-hand, allowing players to hold their ingredients there while holding the tool in their main hand, processing the stack simply by holding the use button.


When the correct tool is used on a valid item, it will be broken down into 1-4 different outputs, which are swiped sideways. Outputs always fly to the direction opposite to the Cutting Board's handle, allowing them to be collected by an item-capturing block, such as a Hopper or Basket. The tool receives 1 point of damage for each processed item.
chapter.21.quest.89.subtitle: The Cutting Board is a workstation where players can break down one item into many outputs, by using a valid tool on it.
chapter.21.quest.89.task.2.title: Any #farmersdelight:tools/knives
chapter.21.quest.9.description.1: Holds tools that will be able to be used in recipes in attached kitchens.
chapter.21.quest.92.description.1: This combination allows wolves to catch up a lot more easily with you or nimble opponents, as well as last longer in battle.
chapter.21.quest.93.task.1.title: Pet Foods
chapter.21.quest.94.description.1:
Feasts are not edible directly as an item; they must be placed down as a block first. When placed, players can use (right-click) them with Bowls to serve themselves with a consumable portion.


The existing feasts in Farmer's Delight provide 4 servings in total. Plated feasts will also leave behind leftovers in the form of a dirty plate; right-clicking or mining it will retrieve the original Bowl, and any bones or food scraps left behind.
chapter.21.quest.94.subtitle: Feasts are very large meals, which can be placed as a block to provide multiple servings to players.
chapter.21.quest.94.task.1.title: Feasts
chapter.21.title: Culinary Expedition
chapter.22.quest.1.description.1:
In order to protect one's lively hood from rat attacks and infestations, they can craft a rat trap


These and traditional defenses against rats, like stone houses and Ocelots can help protect against rodent infestations.
chapter.22.quest.10.description.1: Rat Upgrade: Platter will allow a rat to transfer an entire stack of an items at a time. Typically, a rat without this upgrade will only transfer a single item at a time.
chapter.22.quest.11.description.1:
There are a multitude of upgrades that can be crafted for rats, ranging from simple health and speed boosts, to massive strength and armor gains, along with new abilities, like cooking food and carrying entire stacks of items.


Most specialization of rats comes from Rat Upgrades. These give rats specific stats or abilities, and there are currently 50 rat upgrades available.
chapter.22.quest.11.title: Specialization
chapter.22.quest.14.description.1: Taming a rat is considered difficult as they actively try and avoid players. It is impossible to tame a Plague Rat, but a normal Rat is tamed using Cheese. Like other food items, rats will eat cheese items that are thrown on the floor. However, wild rats have a trust variable that increases with each feeding of cheese. As the rat slowly trusts the player it will not flee as fast or far, and by the time it has had 10 cheese, it will trust the player enough not to flee. Once the rat has been fed cheese 10 times, each additional feeding will have a 33% chance of taming the rat. It can take up to 15 times to tame a rat. Rats are tamed when they make heart particles and can be interacted with.
chapter.22.quest.14.task.1.title: Taming
chapter.22.quest.15.description.1:
Tamed rats have a menu that can be accessed by interacting on them with most items or an empty hand.


In this menu, the player can change the helmet and banner the rat is wearing, change the rat's 3 equipped upgrades, and the item held in the rat's hands or mouth. More importantly, the player can cycle through rat commands by pressing the arrows to the right. The current status of the rat and its gender are also displayed.
chapter.22.quest.15.task.1.title: Rat Menu
chapter.22.quest.16.description.1:
Rats have a variety of commands that can be changed in their menu, or through the use of a Rat Flute. They are as follows:
- Wander - The rat will mill around aimlessly like most vanilla creatures. Note that the rat will still defend its owner while under this command.
- Stay Here - The rat will slouch upwards and sit, not moving at all and not following any other tasks.
- Follow Me - The rat will follow the owner like a Wolf, and defend the owner from attacks.
- Hunt Prey - The rat will target any animals and monsters in the area and attack them. Rats will not attack baby mobs.
- Gather Items - The rat will pick up any items on the floor.
- Harvest - The rat will break grass blocks and crops and pick up the drops. Some upgrades, like the Rat Upgrade: Miner, Rat Upgrade: Planter and Rat Upgrade: Fisherman override this command.
- Transport Items - The rat will carry items from a pickup container (like a chest) and move them to a deposit container.


Note: For the Hunt Prey, Gather Items, Harvest and Transport Items commands, players can use a Cheese Staff on containers to designate them as pick up and drop off locations.
chapter.22.quest.16.task.1.title: Rat Commands
chapter.22.quest.18.description.1: Clicking with the Rat flute will make a flute noise and command all rats within the local area. Sneak+Clicking will cycle through and change the command the flute gives.
chapter.22.quest.2.description.1:
Important aspect of Rats is cheese. Cheese is made by pouring milk into a cauldron


Asides from being a good food source, cheese is also used to tame wild rats, and for a plethora of rat-related crafting recipes.
chapter.22.quest.3.description.1: This can be obtained by killing nether rats, they spawn rarely on striders.
chapter.22.quest.4.description.1: Rats are small creatures that spawn at night in the overworld, just like monsters. They are usually afraid of players and will run from them on sight. They can become quite a nuisance as rats are able to dig through wooden walls, steal food and seeds from chests, and destroy crops. Additionally, rats can sneak through fences and navigate through doors.
chapter.22.quest.6.description.1:
Rat Cages are blocks crafted with iron bars, iron ingots, and wheat. They are used to contain and breed rats. Any rats that are riding the player's shoulders or head can be deposited in the cage by interacting with it. Rats in cages can be released by clicking on the cage again. There is no set limit to how many rats can be in a cage, but vanilla's entity cramming rules still apply. Rat cages can be decorated through the use of several items known as Rat Cage Decorations. Rat Tubes can also be connected to cages. Rat Cages connect to adjacent cage blocks to form one large cage.


Rats of opposing genders in the same cage will breed as long as a Rat Breeding Lantern is placed in the cage. Their pups have a chance of having new color mutations not present in their parents.


Tamed Rats can be made to do a variety of things, but one of the most important of these is auto-crafting.


One can start the autocrafting process by giving a tamed rat the Crafting Upgrade, and placing the rat on top of a Rat Crafting Table
chapter.22.quest.7.description.1: There are over 30 unique decorations for rat cages including rat hammocks and rat igloos. These can be applied to a rat cage by clicking on the cage with the respective item. They can be removed by trying to replace the decoration or by breaking the Rat Cage Block.
chapter.22.quest.8.description.1: Rat tubes are plastic tubes that can be attached to cages and blocks. Right clicking a rat tube will create an opening for rats to enter.
chapter.22.quest.9.description.1:
In order to use the Cheese Staff, it must be "bound" to a rat. This is done by Right-Clicking the rat with the cheese staff in hand. Once bound to a rat, the cheese staff can then be clicked on any block.


Click on a chest or container block with the bound staff in hand to open up the Cheese Staff Menu. Here the player can mark the container as either a pick-up or drop off a container for the rat's various commands.


The Staff can also be used to set a home point for the rat. The home point is the block that the rat will wander around when set to "Wander" command.
chapter.22.title: Cheesy Business
chapter.23.quest.1.description.1:
The Drawer Controller will allow you to connect all storage drawers in a 12 block radius making a large combined storage.


You can deposit items into the entire system by right clicking items onto it. Double right clicking the controller will attempt to dump your enitre inventory into the system, but only if they currently exist in the system.
chapter.23.quest.10.description.1: Half-size 2x2 storage drawers will store 4 stacks of an item per drawer (16 stacks overall).
chapter.23.quest.10.task.1.title: Half Storage Drawer: Four Items
chapter.23.quest.11.description.1: Trim pieces will allow you to extend your network around corners or other configurations without sacrificing a true storage drawer. It is helpful when setting up a controller based system.
chapter.23.quest.11.task.1.title: Storage Drawers Trim
chapter.23.quest.12.description.1: The storage downgrade will drop the storage of the drawer it is installed in to one stack.
chapter.23.quest.13.description.1: The first level of storage upgrade will increase the storage of a drawer block by 2 times.
chapter.23.quest.14.description.1: The second level of storage upgrade will increase the storage of a drawer block by 4 times.
chapter.23.quest.15.description.1: The third level of storage upgrade will increase the storage of a drawer block by 8 times.
chapter.23.quest.16.description.1: The fourth level of storage upgrade will increase the storage of a drawer block by 16 times.
chapter.23.quest.17.description.1: The fifth, and final, level of storage upgrade will increase the storage of a drawer block by 32 times.
chapter.23.quest.18.description.1: The void upgrade will void any items added to the drawer past its max capacity.
chapter.23.quest.19.description.1: The conversion upgrade will convert materials from different mods to a single type. (You should not run into this in this pack).
chapter.23.quest.2.description.1: The Drawer Controller Slave will allow you to extend your storage system when connected to a storage controller. This is more performance friendly than having multiple controllers.
chapter.23.quest.20.description.1: This upgrade template is the base of many upgrades that can be applied to storage drawers.
chapter.23.quest.21.description.1: The illumination upgrade will make the item and number count on the front of the drawer glow, being more visible in less lit areas.
chapter.23.quest.22.description.1: The redstone upgrade will ouptut a redstone signal equivalent to the level that the storage is full.
chapter.23.quest.23.description.1: The min redstone upgrade will output a redstone signal equivalent to the lowest filled drawer level.
chapter.23.quest.24.description.1: The max redstone upgrade will output a redstone signal equivalent to how full the most filled drawer.
chapter.23.quest.25.subtitle: Connects to adjacent inventories allowing Storage Terminal to see all of the items
chapter.23.quest.26.subtitle: Connects to inventory behind it and list the items in that inventory.
chapter.23.quest.27.subtitle: Converts the block in front of it into an inventory
chapter.23.quest.28.subtitle: Used to extend connection between Inventory Connector and the inventory
chapter.23.quest.29.subtitle: Connects inventories across long distances
chapter.23.quest.3.description.1:
Compacting drawers are a special drawer that will hold a specific material type and allow it to be changed between its different material amounts.


For example, loading this drawer with a iron block will allow you to pull the iron block, 9 iron ingots, or 81 iron nuggets from it with no crafting required.
chapter.23.quest.30.subtitle: Cable camouflage
chapter.23.quest.31.subtitle: Can be used to connect Inventory Connectors with each other
chapter.23.quest.32.subtitle: Advanced terminal with crafting table
chapter.23.quest.33.description.1:
Shift-right click on terminal to bind it.


Terminal should be in clear sight when clicking on it
chapter.23.quest.33.subtitle: Extend your reach to the terminal (16 blocks)
chapter.23.quest.35.subtitle: Imports and exports items from the storage network
chapter.23.quest.36.subtitle: Advanced version of wireless terminal (64 blocks)
chapter.23.quest.4.description.1:
The Drawer Key will allow you to lock an item to a storage drawer slot. This will lock that item into that slot, even when all items are removed from the drawer.


The Quantify Key will allow you to show/hide the storage drawer display of the number of items contained on the face of the drawer.
chapter.23.quest.5.description.1: Full-size 1x1 storage drawers will store 32 stacks of an item.
chapter.23.quest.5.task.1.title: Full Storage Drawer: Single Item
chapter.23.quest.6.description.1: Full-size 1x2 storage drawers will store 16 stacks of an item per drawer (32 stacks overall).
chapter.23.quest.6.task.1.title: Full Storage Drawer: Two Items
chapter.23.quest.7.description.1: Full-size 2x2 storage drawers will store 8 stacks of an item per drawer (32 stacks overall).
chapter.23.quest.7.task.1.title: Full Storage Drawer: Four Items
chapter.23.quest.8.description.1: Half-size 1x1 storage drawers will store 16 stacks of an item.
chapter.23.quest.8.task.1.title: Half Storage Drawer: One Item
chapter.23.quest.9.description.1: Half-size 1x2 storage drawers will store 8 stacks of an item per drawer (16 stacks overall).
chapter.23.quest.9.task.1.title: Half Storage Drawer: Two Items
chapter.23.title: Storage Solutions
chapter.24.quest.1.description.1: The Wrench is used to rotate blocks already placed in the world.
chapter.24.quest.10.description.1: An invisible item frame for showing your items!
chapter.24.quest.11.description.1: Put a hopper above it and it will drop all items below it.
chapter.24.quest.12.description.1: Cranks are used to give the exact redstone signal you want
chapter.24.quest.12.title: The Crankonator
chapter.24.quest.14.description.1: The Cog Block can transmit redstone vertically!
chapter.24.quest.14.title: VERTICAL REDSTONE?!
chapter.24.quest.15.description.1: stores liquids and captures tiny mobs
chapter.24.quest.17.description.1: Teleports your nearby pets to you. Useful for getting them out of sticky situations
chapter.24.quest.18.description.1: emits redstone signal when a key is used on it. The key can be renamed so only that key can be used.
chapter.24.quest.19.description.1: used to unlock lock blocks. You can put it in any curios slot.
chapter.24.quest.2.description.1: Rotation lock is enabled by pressing K by default on your keyboard. You will see a cube to the right of your crosshair. This makes all blocks you place face in the direction you were facing in when the lock was enabled. Press it again to change direction and again to turn it off.
chapter.24.quest.2.task.1.title: Press K
chapter.24.quest.2.title: Rotation Lock
chapter.24.quest.20.description.1: You can set it to speak a message or show it in chat. Perfect for annoying your friends (or enemies!)
chapter.24.quest.21.description.1: can place blocks from a distance!
chapter.24.quest.22.description.1: rotates blocks and mobs standing on it
chapter.24.quest.22.title: How the tables have turned...
chapter.24.quest.23.description.1: Launches you into the air when powered, or if you land on it from a high place
chapter.24.quest.24.description.1: These strong doors can be locked with a key and can be opened with your hand.
chapter.24.quest.25.description.1: These doors can be opened with hand but NOT redstone signals.
chapter.24.quest.26.description.1: Emits light based on its redstone signal.
chapter.24.quest.27.description.1: Can be placed on top of sticks to create a flagpole. Right-click a flagpole to raise the flag, hold sneak to lower it.
chapter.24.quest.27.title: Flags
chapter.24.quest.28.description.1: Some Rod and Book Items like Sticks, Blaze Rods, and Prismarine Rods can be placed as blocks into the world. Search "Placeable" in JEI to see which items can be placed as blocks.
chapter.24.quest.28.title: Placeable Items
chapter.24.quest.29.description.1: Created by using a hoe on gravel.
chapter.24.quest.3.description.1: Ropes can be climbed like ladders. The ones from supplementaries can also be passed through.
chapter.24.quest.3.task.1.title: Any #supplementaries:ropes
chapter.24.quest.3.title: Ropes
chapter.24.quest.30.description.1: Safes are harder to break shulker boxes that can be only be opened by the player who placed them.
chapter.24.quest.31.description.1: A small early-game shulker box that can only hold 5 items. Carry too many in your inventory and you get slowed down
chapter.24.quest.32.description.1: Throwable Explosive that only breaks grass, torches and other weak blocks. Aim at a mob's feet to send them flying!
chapter.24.quest.33.description.1:
Rarer version of bomb that can only be found as loot and from a special trader...
More Powerful than bomb and sets mobs on fire!
chapter.24.quest.34.description.1: The "fan" of this modpack, bellows blow mobs in the direction they are facing when powered.
chapter.24.quest.34.subtitle: The Fan of the Modpack
chapter.24.quest.35.description.1:
The book for more information about Supplementaries items.
Supplementaries Quests are on the left, Quark Quests are on the right.
chapter.24.quest.36.description.1: Craft with a dye to create a colored rune. Runes change the enchantment glint color on your equipment when combined in an anvil with the enchanted item of your choice. The blank rune removes other rune colors.
chapter.24.quest.37.description.1: Combine runes to craft the Rainbow Rune
chapter.24.quest.38.description.1: Only drops from Respawned Ender Dragons. Used to create a copy of an elytra
chapter.24.quest.39.description.1: Only found at the bottom of the Mining Dimension, this tough rock serves as a nice fortification for your bases.
chapter.24.quest.39.subtitle: Rock Bottom
chapter.24.quest.39.title: Deepslate
chapter.24.quest.4.description.1: Places random blocks from your hotbar. Useful for making natural looking walls and paths.
chapter.24.quest.40.description.1: Place an animal's food in it and it will automatically breed animals for you
chapter.24.quest.41.description.1: Can only be activated by players.
chapter.24.quest.42.description.1: The Brass Lantern can only be obtained from Librarian Villagers. You cannot find it anywhere else!
chapter.24.quest.42.reward.1.title: Dragonsteel?
chapter.24.quest.43.description.1: This guy is really hard to find, don't bother looking for him
chapter.24.quest.43.task.1.title: Find the Red Merchant
chapter.24.quest.43.title: The Rarest Trader
chapter.24.quest.44.description.1: Created with Amethyst in a fletching table, Amethyst arrows deal less damage than their normal counterparts but spread shards where it lands, dealing small area of effect damage.
chapter.24.quest.45.description.1: Feed a Skeleton Horse a whole stack of rotten flesh to convert them into a Zombie Horse!
chapter.24.quest.45.task.1.title: Zombie Horse Conversion
chapter.24.quest.46.description.1:
A block that is a clock.


Right clicking it will tell you the exact minecraft time.
chapter.24.quest.47.description.1: When powered randomly powers the block to either the left or right of it.
chapter.24.quest.47.subtitle: Looking both ways
chapter.24.quest.48.description.1: Works like an inverted comparator; it combines the total of 3 sides (indicated by red triangles) into the 4th side.
chapter.24.quest.49.description.1:
Obtained by using an empty bottle at y-130 in the overworld.


You can place it like a block, but in mid-air without needing another block.
chapter.24.quest.5.description.1:
When powered starts falling upwards.


When its on a ceiling it starts falling down when powered again.
chapter.24.quest.50.description.1:
The grate lets items fall through it but not mobs.


Animals will also try to avoid walking on grates.
chapter.24.quest.50.subtitle: Grateness awaits
chapter.24.quest.51.description.1:
Any rope or chain can be stored inside the block (including from other mods)


When the pulley is powered by a turntable going down, it will drop the rope/chain underneath it.


Clicking the turntable will make the pulley pull the ropes/chains back up, taking the block underneath it up with it.
chapter.24.quest.6.description.1: Emits a redstone signal when looked at.
chapter.24.quest.7.description.1: Bamboo spikes are useful traps to protect you base from mobs. They can be tipped with potion effects!
chapter.24.quest.8.description.1: Used to measure the amount blocks between two points.
chapter.24.quest.9.description.1: Used to find slime chunks; the areas where slimes can spawn in

chapter.25.quest.55.title: Enchanter's Hammer
chapter.25.quest.56.description.1:
Collect all 92 glyphs from Ars Nouveau and then go insane trying to craft the last glyphs.


The title can be claimed in the Titles chapter after completing this.
