chapter.26.quest.1.description.1: The Guide book for Enigmatic Legacy that doubles as a melee weapon.
chapter.26.quest.10.description.1: A scroll that becomes more powerful the more curses you wield.
chapter.26.quest.11.description.1: A single use item that can fully repair any equipment with durability.
chapter.26.quest.12.description.1: Attracts items to you when worn.
chapter.26.quest.14.description.1: A powerful ingot found in the end (see Etherium Ore in End Exporation Chapter)
chapter.26.quest.15.description.1: Protect your pets from harm with this book. Pairs well with the Guide to Animal Companionship
chapter.26.quest.16.description.1:
Prevents you from hurting animals.


Just don't bring it with you when fighting a dragon...
chapter.26.quest.16.subtitle: No more accidental bunny murders
chapter.26.quest.17.description.1:
An upgraded version of the Aknowledgement Guide book that can be used as a weapon.


But really don't bother making this one unless you want a fancier book. We tried to make it good. Multiple times.
chapter.26.quest.18.description.1:
Disenchants an item and stores them all in one enchanted book.


The disenchanted item still keeps its stacking Repair Cost however.
chapter.26.quest.19.description.1: A simple ring that grants +1 Armor.
chapter.26.quest.2.description.1: Grants experience, Magic Skill experience, and knowledge points (which do nothing).
chapter.26.quest.20.description.1: A stronger version of the magnetic ring that can pull items from twice as far.
chapter.26.quest.21.description.1: Allows the player to access their ender chest inventory using a keybind.
chapter.26.quest.25.description.1: Bestows Strength upon those who are wounding.
chapter.26.quest.26.description.1: Can remove the ring of seven curses, but not without a sacrifice.
chapter.26.quest.27.subtitle: You should really read what it is you're eating...
chapter.26.quest.28.description.1:
Only the first is free.


You only have yourself to blame.
chapter.26.quest.28.subtitle: Cures the Forbidden Fruit
chapter.26.quest.28.title: Potion of Redemption
chapter.26.quest.29.description.1: The teleportation powers of an eye of ender contained in a golden casing for convenient mob transportation.
chapter.26.quest.3.description.1: The base ingredient for making scrolls.
chapter.26.quest.30.description.1:
No mystery to be had. There isn't anything special.


Enjoy melting your insides with this. Mithridatism, right? Yeah, that's not going to work here.
chapter.26.quest.30.subtitle: My cup of tea.
chapter.26.quest.31.description.1: Makes piglins neutral without having to wear gold armor.
chapter.26.quest.32.subtitle: The most powerful paxel
chapter.26.quest.4.description.1: Stores an endless amount of xp, though transferring large amounts may take some time...
chapter.26.quest.5.description.1:
The flying powers of the Wither will be bestowed upon you when you are near its hearts beam.


(Grants flight when near a beacon)
chapter.26.quest.8.description.1:
Base for making Cursed Scrolls.


You can also wear it like other scrolls but no effects are given.
chapter.26.quest.8.subtitle: The Dankest Scroll
chapter.26.quest.9.description.1: Allows you to barter with piglins even with the ring of seven curses, and improves both villager trading and piglin bartering.
chapter.26.title: Enigmatic Legacy
chapter.27.quest.1.description.1: Eidolon is a magic mod that draws on a lot of different inspirations, with aspects of alchemy and theurgy. It takes a bit of a dark perspective, also featuring mechanics themed around necromancy and soul manipulation. If you have ever wanted to play as a dark mage, performing strange rituals and communing with dark gods, this is the mod for you.
chapter.27.quest.10.description.1: Build an altar and pray to the dark lord. Perform sacrifices, upgrade your altar, improve your reputation with them, and they might reveal to you new knowledge or grant you new abilities...
chapter.27.quest.10.task.1.title: Theurgy
chapter.27.quest.11.description.1: Perform alchemy at the crucible, and tinker with magic items at a new workbench. Using soul shards and a huge variety of other ingredients, take your pick of a large selection of magical weapons, tools, armor, and curios.
chapter.27.quest.11.task.1.title: Artifice
chapter.27.quest.9.description.1: Using shards of pure soul energy, activate powerful rituals at the brazier. Create new items, summon monsters, and ward huge areas from hostile creatures.
chapter.27.quest.9.task.1.title: Rituals
chapter.27.title: Dark Magic
chapter.28.quest.25.description.1: Corrupted Beacon but blue. This one does not use souls.
chapter.28.quest.27.description.1: Grants the Party Starter Effect. Whenever you attack create an explosion that damages mobs.
chapter.28.quest.28.description.1: Either sets mobs on fire for 8 seconds, inflicts slowness, or strikes them with lightning.
chapter.28.quest.31.description.1: The next 5 arrows you shoot are unaffected by water.
chapter.28.quest.33.description.1:
Summons an iron golem to fight for you.


And before you ask no the golem does not drop iron on death.


Due to a bug you may need to unequip then reequip the artifact to summon a new pet.
chapter.28.quest.34.description.1:
Summons a free pet wolf for you!


You cannot summon another wolf until the first wolf dies or is converted into a doggy talents dog.


Due to a bug you may need to unequip then reequip the artifact to summon a new pet.
chapter.28.quest.35.description.1:
Summon a llama pet.


The llama follows you so its useful to carry your stuff if you add a chest.


Due to a bug you may need to unequip then reequip the artifact to summon a new pet.
chapter.28.quest.36.description.1:
Gives mobs Resistance Negative 2 and Weakness. (They take more damage)


Also dispels the Resistance effect already present on mobs, so its very useful on strong champions.
chapter.28.quest.37.description.1:
Costs 15 Souls.


Strike lightning at the mob you are looking at.


You will waste souls if you are not looking at a mob.
chapter.28.quest.38.description.1: Give yourself some resistance II for a few seconds.
chapter.28.quest.39.description.1:
Makes up to 3 nearby mobs stop attacking you and attack other mobs.


However attacking them will cause them to attack you again.
chapter.28.quest.4.description.1:
Infuse Runes into a Relic to create a new one.


Insert the needed runes into the four slots on the sides of the altar.


The altar will then ask for items to be dropped onto it to complete the process.
chapter.28.quest.40.description.1: The next 7 arrows you shoot are on fire. Useful for crossbows or other bows that can't get the flame enchantment.
chapter.28.quest.41.description.1: Activate to do a short hop. Useful as a weak double jump
chapter.28.quest.42.description.1:
Spends up to 64 Souls to heal up to 6 health.


Won't be used if you are at full health.
chapter.28.quest.44.description.1: Summon an ice chunk above mobs that briefly stuns them.
chapter.28.quest.46.description.1: Keeps nearby enemies stuck in place for 5 seconds.
chapter.28.quest.47.description.1: Spend 40 Souls to create a powerful explosion.
chapter.28.quest.48.description.1: Grants Glowing, Speed, Resistance IV and Invisibility for 3 seconds.
chapter.28.quest.49.description.1:
Costs 10 Souls.


The next 3 arrows you shoot ignore gravity
chapter.28.quest.5.description.1:
Used to repair Relics.


Place a relic onto the Anvil by Right-Clicking the top surface of the anvil.


Equip your Runic Hammer and use it on the placed item to restore durability.


This process costs experience points and may take some time
chapter.28.quest.50.description.1: Grants the Shielding effect, which makes you immune to projectiles.
chapter.28.quest.51.description.1:
Costs 5 Souls. All non-hostile entities within the totem's aura cannot be killed (stays at 1 hp)


Totem lasts around 12 seconds despite what the tooltip says.
chapter.28.quest.52.description.1: Summons bees that fight for you!
chapter.28.quest.53.description.1:
Rapidly spends souls to shoot a beam that rapidly damages all mobs in front of you.


The Damage can be boosted by holding a sword with certain enchantments.
chapter.28.quest.54.description.1:
Summons a Sheep.


Due to a bug this one won't summon unless you have another summoning artifact in your curios slots.
chapter.28.quest.55.description.1: Orange version of the Corrupted Beacon.
chapter.28.quest.56.description.1: The next 5 arrows strike lightning on foes.
chapter.28.quest.6.description.1:
Used to repair Relics.


For usage, see the Runic Anvil.
chapter.28.title: Trinkets 'n Curios
chapter.29.quest.1.description.1:
Step 1:
Find a wild wolf (the Vanilla Minecraft wolf).
Step 2:
Feed it bones (right click with a bone in your hand) until hearts appear above its head. If a collar appears on its neck and it sits down, you've done it right!
Step 3:
Feed the dog at least one Training Treat and the dog will disappear for a very brief second and a dog without a collar will take its place. At this point, you now have a Doggy Talents dog.
chapter.29.quest.1.title: Dog Bone
chapter.29.quest.10.title: Dog Decorations
chapter.29.quest.11.description.1:
This gives your dog a collar! To equip the collar, right click on your dog with the collar in your main hand. You can customize the color of the collars in a similar fashion as in the Wearable Backpacks mod!
To do so, just add it and dyes in a crafting table or applying it directly to your dog. You can take them off by using the Collar Shears
chapter.29.quest.12.description.1: This special stick gives your dog the Glowing Effect for 5 seconds, the Speed Level 6 effect for 10 seconds, and the Regeneration Level 1 effect for 5 seconds.
chapter.29.quest.13.description.1:
You can play with your dog with this item! First, set your dog into Docile mode, then right click to throw the bone. The dog to take off after the bone, grab it, and give it back to you as a Drool Throw Bone
To throw the bone again, you must clean the bone off first by right clicking it or adding it to a crafting table in order to get a Throw Bone.
chapter.29.quest.14.description.1: This functions the same way as the Throw Bone.
chapter.29.quest.15.description.1: This special bone is required to breed your dogs.
chapter.29.quest.16.description.1:
This acts as a respawn point for your dogs.


Sneak Click the bed with an empty hand \& offhand while your dog is on it to set their spawn to that bed. If done correctly the bed when clicked on again without sneaking will show your dog as the owner of the bed.


If the dog were to ever die clicking their bed will respawn them back where they died.


Dogs also regenerate health faster when on a bed.
chapter.29.quest.16.subtitle: Dogs can respawn too!
chapter.29.quest.17.description.1: The bath is useful with the fisher dog trait as the constant shaking will allow them to catch more fish.
chapter.29.quest.18.description.1: The food bowl can automatically feed your dogs when you're not around
chapter.29.quest.19.description.1: These special shears can cut off the wool collars off your dog. Also, the shears can untame your dog.
chapter.29.quest.2.description.1: The first treat you will need to level up your dog. It can only level the dog to 20. After that, you will require the next tier treat, the Super Treat.
chapter.29.quest.20.description.1:
Modes
These control how the dog reacts to other entities and interacts with you The tips of each mode appear above the dog as in the following image


Docile (D)
In this mode, your dog will follow you but not attack anything. They will also play fetch with you when you throw the Throw Bone or Throw Stick. This mode will show up as the tip,"(D)" just above the dogs name.


Wandering (W)
In this mode, your dog will stay near its bowl and wait for your next command. To set your dog's bowl, simply place one and bring your dog within 1 block of it. This mode will show up as the tip,"(W)" just above the dog's name.


Aggressive (A)
In this mode, your dog will follow you and attack anything that either attacks you or that you attack. This mode will show up as the tip,"(A)" just above the dogs name.


Berserker (B)
In this mode, your dog will follow you and will attack any mob that draws near. This mode will show up as the tip,"(B)" just above the dogs name.


Tactical (T)
In this mode, your dog will follow you but will not attack anything unless you use the whistle to attack the entity you right click on (with the item in hand). This mode will show up as the tip,"(T)" just above the dogs name.
chapter.29.quest.20.task.1.title: Dog Modes
chapter.29.quest.21.description.1:
Pets won't survive against the champions without a good defense.


You can equip armor to your pets by sneaking and right-clicking on them.


You can also swap their armor just by equipping another one to them and you'll get the other one back.


Try equipping armors with aura effects; they can turn your pets into powerful supports!
chapter.29.quest.21.task.1.title: Pet Armoring
chapter.29.quest.22.description.1: These Bones can be used to resize your dogs.
chapter.29.quest.22.title: Big Dogs \& Little Dogs
chapter.29.quest.3.description.1:
Once you have a Doggy Talents dog, you will be able to right click on it with a stick in hand (main or secondary) to open the dog information/talents menu.


This menu allows you to change the name of your dog, toggle its behavior, add talents, and toggle whether to obey other players. In the menu, your dog's basic level, dire level, and level spending points will be displayed just under the name box.


The more you level up your dog using the Treats in this order: Training Treat, Super Treat, Master Treat, and Dire Treat; the more points you have available to spend on your talents. Eventually, the dog will hit its maximum level, which will not
allow you to get anymore points once it hits this level cap.
chapter.29.quest.4.description.1: The second treat you will need to level up your dog. It can only level the dog to 40. After that, you will require the next tier treat, the Master Treat.
chapter.29.quest.5.description.1: The third treat you will need to level up your dog. It can only level the dog to 60. After that, you will require the final tier treat, the Dire Treat.
chapter.29.quest.6.description.1:
The forth and final treat you will need to level up your dog. It adds dire levels, which is maxed at 30. After that, you will no longer have the ability to level up the dog, hence the dog has reached the ultimate level. Also, at the maximum dire
level, end-like particles will begin to emit from your dog.
chapter.29.quest.7.description.1:
The Whistle has 7 different modes which command all your nearby dogs.


Command Stand: Makes your owned dogs stand up


Command Heel: Your Standing Dogs teleport to you. Sitting dogs won't teleport so make sure to use the stand command first


Command Stay: Makes your dogs sit


Command Ok?: Acts same as Stand


Shepherd's Whistle: Dogs with the Shepherd upgrade will put nearby animals on their back and come to you.


Tactical Whistle: The whistle throws a snowball which commands all wolves in Tactical Mode to attack the hit mob.


Roaring Whistle: Dogs with the Roaring Gale talent will use a powerful growl that pushes back mobs.
chapter.29.quest.7.title: Whistle
chapter.29.quest.8.description.1:
This item is like a map, but for locating your dog when it has the Radio Collar equipped. To locate your dog, right click with the item in your main hand and it will give your dog's distance away from you and in which direction it is in. However,
this item only works if the dog is in the same dimension.
chapter.29.quest.9.description.1:
This item allows you to carry food items for your dog. You can feed your dog the items inside by right clicking on your dog with the bag in hand.
You can also place the items from inside the bag into a Food Bowl by right clicking on the bowl with the bag in your hand.
chapter.29.title: A Reliable Friend

chapter.30.quest.1.description.1: Grizzly Bears will randomly drop some of their hair with time.
chapter.30.quest.10.description.1: A rare drop from jungle leaves. Can be used to make a Simple Farming tree whose bananas will work in the same way.
chapter.30.quest.100.description.1:
Encounter a Tarantula Hawk


The Tarantula Hawk is a giant neutral wasp that flies around deserts. They love attacking spiders, which they paralyze and bury underground. They are difficult to fight due to their very erratic flight. They can be healed with flowers.
chapter.30.quest.100.task.1.title: Tarantula Hawk Encountered
chapter.30.quest.101.description.1:
Tame Tarantula Hawk with spider eyes. They can be very good protectors against most monsters.
Two tamed Tarantula Hawks can be bred with fermented spider eyes, where they will then seek out a spider to paralyze and bury. Eventually a baby Tarantula Hawk will emerge from where the spider was buried.
chapter.30.quest.101.task.1.title: Pet Flying Devil
chapter.30.quest.102.description.1:
Feed meat to a Tiger to gain its blessing.


Tigers are large cats found in dense bamboo. They are weary of people and will attack if gotten too near. They are very good hunters and can become nearly invisible while hunting. By feeding them meat, their blessing can be gained which will allow you to approach them and they will come to your aid. They can be bred with Acacia Blossoms. They have potential to be born as white tigers.
chapter.30.quest.102.task.1.title: Blessings of Tony
chapter.30.quest.103.description.1:
Rescue a beached Cachalot Whale.


Cachalot Whales are large neutral creatures found in pretty much every ocean. Their favorite prey are squid. Sometimes during storms they may spawn beached on the shore.
chapter.30.quest.103.task.1.title: Aqua Rescue Force
chapter.30.quest.104.description.1:
What could go wrong jumping on an anthill?


Leafcutter Ants are small ants that eat the leaves off of trees in jungles. Colonies can consist up to 20 ants. Typically only workers are seen but a queen can be summoned by jumping on an anthill. Queens are needed for the colony to repopulate.
chapter.30.quest.104.task.1.title: Ants in my Pants
chapter.30.quest.105.description.1:
Kangaroo Encountered


Large jumping friends of the savanna and badlands, Kangaroos are a neutral creature. They are very good at defending themselves. They can be tamed with carrots where they gain the normal follower characteristics and a accessible storage by sneak right clicking. A melee weapon, helmet, and chestpiece placed in the storage can be used by the Kangaroo. Can be healed with non-meat foods and bred with a dead bush or grass.
chapter.30.quest.105.task.1.title: Kangaroo Jack
chapter.30.quest.106.description.1:
Emu Encountered


A large ground bird, the Emu is found in savanna and badlands. They initially panic when attacked but may return to attack. They like attacking skeletons though. They can be bred with Wheat but cannot be tamed. They will appear in a few different colors.
chapter.30.quest.106.task.1.title: Emu Day Out
chapter.30.quest.107.description.1:
Encounter Enderiophage


The Enderiophage is pretty much just a giant virus commonly found in the End Midlands. It's primary prey is the Endergrades, but it will also attack Endermen. If allowed to pass on its virus it will affect the host until they die and burst with new Enderiophages.
chapter.30.quest.107.task.1.title: End Virus
chapter.30.quest.108.description.1: To heal the End Flu Chorus fruit or milk can be eaten/drank.
chapter.30.quest.108.task.1.title: Hope it isn't Contagious
chapter.30.quest.109.description.1: Long dead birds that now inhabits the Nether. They have a health stealing attack which they use to great effect up to five times.
chapter.30.quest.109.task.1.title: Soul Vulture Encountered
chapter.30.quest.11.description.1: A Crimson Mosquito drop when killed while inflated with blood from a mob.
chapter.30.quest.110.description.1:
Lure a Spectre over in the End and hitch a ride with a lead.


Spectres are a relative of Phantoms but are completely passive. They cannot be attacked by physical means. Their favorite item is a Soul Heart, which they will follow very intently.
chapter.30.quest.110.task.1.title: Hitching a Ride
chapter.30.quest.111.description.1:
Encounter a Straddler


A Straddler is large rocky version of a Strider found in Basalt Deltas. They are aggressive and will attack an explorers they see by launching Stradpoles at them.
chapter.30.quest.111.task.1.title: Straddler Encountered
chapter.30.quest.112.description.1: Feeding a Stradpole a Crimson Mosquito Larva and it might grow up.
chapter.30.quest.112.task.1.title: Lava Tadpole Feast
chapter.30.quest.113.description.1: The Crimson Mosquito is a native of Crimson Forests where it will suck the blood of almost any creature. It can then spit this blood back at other targets.
chapter.30.quest.113.task.1.title: Crimson Mosquito Encountered
chapter.30.quest.114.description.1:
The Warped Toad is a rare spawn in Warped Forests which is neutral. Its favorite food is Crimson Mosquitos so it may be worth having one of these as a friend.
It can be healed with maggots and bred with Crimson Mosquito Larva.
chapter.30.quest.114.task.1.title: Mosquito Repellent
chapter.30.quest.115.description.1: What could happen when a Crimson Mosquito feeds on a Mungus covered with Warped Fungus?
chapter.30.quest.115.task.1.title: Mad Scientist
chapter.30.quest.116.description.1:
Kill the Warped Mosquito


The Warped Mosquito is a very dangerous evolution of a Crimson Mosquito. It will attack pretty much everything and will suck blood to regenerate health.
chapter.30.quest.116.task.1.title: Bye Bye Mega Chad
chapter.30.quest.117.description.1: The seal is a cute, if not loud, creature frequently found on beaches or icebergs. Usually they are found sleeping but are very good swimmers. Giving a seal three fish with "trade" with the seal and they will dive into the water and bring back a sea related item (some are valuable). Can be bred with lobster tails.
chapter.30.quest.117.task.1.title: Seal
chapter.30.quest.118.description.1: Shoebills are strange birds that inhabit swamps and will flee if attacked. They are more of solitary fishmen and won't keep all of their catch which can be picked up. They can be fed Crocodile eggs to increase the lure of their catches and Blobfish to increase the luck of their catch. They cannot be bred.
chapter.30.quest.118.task.1.title: Shoebill
chapter.30.quest.119.description.1: The Snow Leopard is a big cat found in snowy mountain area where they live in solitude. They won't be aggressive to players but love hunting and will protect themselves. While hunting they often create extra drops due to their skill (like high luck). They cannot be tamed but can be bred with Moose Ribs.
chapter.30.quest.119.task.1.title: Snow Leopard
chapter.30.quest.12.description.1: A random drop when killing a Crimson Mosquito.
chapter.30.quest.120.description.1:
Crows are annoyancing birds found in forests and plains where they circle fields and stop crop growth. They can be scared away with a scarecrow of a simple carved pumpkin. They will pickup any food or seeds and eat them.
They can be tamed by giving them some pumpkin seeds. When tamed they can follow the the basic tamed animal rules (Stay, follow, wander) but can also collect items. When set to gather mode crows will look for chests with item frames on them. Whatever item is in the frame will be collected and placed into the chest.
chapter.30.quest.120.task.1.title: Crow
chapter.30.quest.121.description.1: Mungi are mushroom creatures found in different Mushroom biomes. They are completely passive. They have mushroomson them that on them that they will grow more of depending on the biome. They have a chance of creating giant mushrooms. If killed with 5 mushrooms on it, it will explode and spread their mushroom covering them. They can be bred with Mushroom Stew.
chapter.30.quest.121.task.1.title: Mungus
chapter.30.quest.122.description.1:
The Platypus is a strange little animal that can be found in rivers. It has a poisonous attack to return on attackers. It can be bred with Lobster Tails.
It's special ability is that when fed with redstone it will seak out clay blocks where it will dig up maggots and clay balls.
chapter.30.quest.122.task.1.title: Platypus
chapter.30.quest.123.description.1: The Tasmanian Devil is a small creature found in temperate forests. They can be found in groups making growling noises. They will also heartily defend themselves if attacked. Can be fed rotten flesh to release a howl to scare away all monsters for a time. They cannot be tamed but can be bred with meat.
chapter.30.quest.123.task.1.title: Tasmanian Devil
chapter.30.quest.124.description.1: Raccoons are natives of plains and forests where they can be seen foraging for food. They will come up to players to beg if food is being held but they will also steal food from chests. Will wash food when near water. Can be tamed when given an egg near water and can be bred with bread.
chapter.30.quest.124.task.1.title: Raccoon
chapter.30.quest.125.description.1: The Gazelle is a small creature of the savannas is very timid and prefers its large groups which will flee at the first sign of danger.
chapter.30.quest.125.task.1.title: Gazelle
chapter.30.quest.126.description.1: This annoying bug is pretty common across the overworld. They will chase and bite zombies to near death. They are bred with rotten flesh. Make sure these do not get into the Nether....
chapter.30.quest.126.task.1.title: Fly Encountered
chapter.30.quest.127.description.1:
The Moose, the Big Boy of the Tundra and Taiga, are neutral but very capable of protecting themselves.
Can be bred with dandelions.
chapter.30.quest.127.task.1.title: Moose
chapter.30.quest.128.description.1:
The Komodo Dragon is the largest lizard you will ever see, which you could experience travelling through the badlands. They will attack almost anything so watch out and they have a very poisonous bite.
If given a very large amount of rotten flesh they can be tamed where they will fiercely protect their friends and are also a good mount.
chapter.30.quest.128.task.1.title: Komodo Dragon
chapter.30.quest.129.description.1: The Roadrunner is a quick ground bird that can be found in deserts and badlands. They are predator of Rattlesnakes. Can be bred with maggots.
chapter.30.quest.129.task.1.title: Roadrunner
chapter.30.quest.13.description.1: A custom weapon that fires mosquito spit as a weapon. Blood sacks can be used as ammunition.
chapter.30.quest.130.description.1: A rare underground bug that can be found deep down. It slowly moves but it has a powerful bite and is poisonous.
chapter.30.quest.130.task.1.title: Cave Centipede
chapter.30.quest.131.description.1:
Cockroaches can be be found underground in the dark corners of caves. While they are normally scared of people they can be fed with sugar or bread to make them more comfortable. They will eat any food dropped on the ground as well.
Their most unique ability may be the ability to lose their head and keep on running though. They can be bred with sugar.
chapter.30.quest.131.task.1.title: Cockroach
chapter.30.quest.132.description.1: A Lobster is a small sea creature found in the water right off the beach. They will pinch anything aggresive to them but usually won't chase. Can come in a number of colors.
chapter.30.quest.132.task.1.title: Lobster
chapter.30.quest.133.description.1: This..... squishy fish is usually found deep in oceans. When a slimeball is used on a blobfish will allow it to survive on land.
chapter.30.quest.133.task.1.title: Blobfish
chapter.30.quest.134.description.1: A Hammerhead Shark are a large creature native in warmer oceans. It is a predator of any creature below half health.
chapter.30.quest.134.task.1.title: Hammerhead Shark
chapter.30.quest.135.description.1: This large animal of the End is a peaceful floating creature that is happy spending its days just floating around Chorus Forests eating chorus fruits. You can lure a Endergrade over to you by holding a Chorus fruit which you can also use to breed them.
chapter.30.quest.135.task.1.title: Endergrade
chapter.30.quest.136.description.1: The Bone Serpent is a native of the lava lakes of the Nether where it preys on almost everything, especially Wither Skeletons.
chapter.30.quest.136.task.1.title: Bone Serpent
chapter.30.quest.137.description.1: The Dropbear is an evil creature native to the Nether Wastes. It hangs from the ceiling where it waits for things to walk beneath it to drop down upon and attack.
chapter.30.quest.137.task.1.title: Dropbear Encountered
chapter.30.quest.137.task.2.title: Dropbear
chapter.30.quest.138.description.1: This potion, made from bear hair and potions of strength, will create a potion giving knockback resistance.
chapter.30.quest.139.description.1:
Placing a crimson mosquito larva into a capsid causes it to transform into a mysterious worm.


Can also be bought from the Enderologist villager.
chapter.30.quest.14.description.1: A Rattlesnake drop when killed, usually when protecting other creatures from its venomous bite.
chapter.30.quest.140.description.1: Tossing the worm into the end void will summon the void worm
chapter.30.quest.141.description.1: With the drops from the void worm you can craft a dimensional carver, a way to teleport you and other mobs back to spawn, even across dimensions!
chapter.30.quest.142.description.1: A block that when powered by redstone deals damage to anyone caught within the jaws
chapter.30.quest.15.description.1: Once you lead a Endergrade down to you with a Chorus fruit you can saddle them much like a pig in the overworld. By crafting a Chorus Fruit on a Stick you can lead an Endergrade around in any direction you want.
chapter.30.quest.16.description.1: A random Hammerhead Shark item that may drop when it attacks.
chapter.30.quest.17.description.1: These arrows travel better underwater where they deal extra damage to sea creatures.
chapter.30.quest.18.description.1: Just in case you want to move some lobsters around.
chapter.30.quest.19.description.1: A Lobster item that drops when they are killed.
chapter.30.quest.2.description.1: Roadrunners will drop these if they lose battles against Rattlesnakes.... or you.
chapter.30.quest.20.description.1: Would go nice with some butter.
chapter.30.quest.21.description.1: An occasional drop from live Komodo Dragons.
chapter.30.quest.22.description.1: Taking a few drops of saliva and putting it into a bottle could be pretty potent.
chapter.30.quest.24.description.1: A very potent poison resistance potion made from poison essence and a Rattlesnake tail.
chapter.30.quest.25.description.1: A random drop from Capuchin Monkeys when fed bananas.
chapter.30.quest.26.description.1:
A very "unique" soup......
Maybe try some of this better soup.
chapter.30.quest.27.description.1: This item is a Cave Centipede drop when they are killed, where multiple can be dropped.
chapter.30.quest.28.description.1: Grants the wearer the ability to climb walls.
chapter.30.quest.29.description.1: The larva for a Crimson Mosquito, made from a maggot and proboscis. Is the favorite treat of the Warped Toad, and will allow you to tame it with a few of these.
chapter.30.quest.3.description.1: These boots, which are fitted with Roadrunner feathers, will allow users to run faster on sand.
chapter.30.quest.30.description.1: Every 7-10 days a moose can drop one of their antlers.
chapter.30.quest.31.description.1: By mounting some antlers to this hat it will give the player a knockback ability.
chapter.30.quest.32.description.1: These are some big ribs that are dropped when a moose is killed.
chapter.30.quest.34.description.1: A drop when a Raccoon is killed.
chapter.30.quest.35.description.1: This fun hat will give the wearer a speed boost while sneaking.
chapter.30.quest.36.description.1: When you want a slimey little buddy of your own.
chapter.30.quest.37.description.1: The sad little body of a blobfish when it is killed.
chapter.30.quest.38.description.1: By compressing blobfish down into a bottle, Fish Oil can be made that can have some interesting properties in the rain.
chapter.30.quest.39.description.1: This Rattle is made with Rattlesnake tail. It will catch the attention of Cockroaches.
chapter.30.quest.4.description.1: A drop from Bone Serpents when they leap out of lava and are killed.
chapter.30.quest.40.description.1: A random drop when killing Cockroaches.
chapter.30.quest.41.description.1: A rebuilt wing of a Cockroach.
chapter.30.quest.42.description.1: This potion will allow a person to go almost invisible to hostile bugs.
chapter.30.quest.43.description.1: A rare drop from acacia trees.
chapter.30.quest.44.description.1: After Soul Vulture has become filled from its health drain attack it may drop this infused heart.
chapter.30.quest.45.description.1: This potion will give the drinker the Soul Vultures health sapping power.
chapter.30.quest.46.description.1: Shearing mossy Alligator Snapping Turtles has a chance to drop this.
chapter.30.quest.47.description.1: This modified turtle helmet provides knockback resistance and allows the wearer to breathe underwater for 15 more seconds. Also has a chance to return melee attacks.
chapter.30.quest.48.description.1: The core of a Guster that can drop when they are killed.
chapter.30.quest.49.description.1: Throw a little sand in their eyes!
chapter.30.quest.5.description.1: This special potion will allow you to look through lava like it was water.
chapter.30.quest.50.description.1: The Gustmaker, when powered with redstone, emits little Gusters in a line that can push stuff around.
chapter.30.quest.51.description.1: What gives the Warped Mosquito its strength.
chapter.30.quest.52.description.1: The warped power behind the Warped Mosquito.
chapter.30.quest.54.description.1: Try to catch a Stradpole in a bucket of lava.
chapter.30.quest.55.description.1: A rare Straddler drop that has an interesting use.
chapter.30.quest.56.description.1: A dyeable board that allows you to surf lava. Be careful to not hit anything though because you may fall off.
chapter.30.quest.57.description.1: An occasional drop from a live Emu.
chapter.30.quest.58.description.1: A whole omelet in a shell.
chapter.30.quest.6.description.1: A drop from Gazelle's when they are unfortunately killed, but they also may drop some mutton.
chapter.30.quest.60.description.1: Gives the wearer the Emu dodge ability.
chapter.30.quest.61.description.1: A Dropbear drop which can be used to make flint and steel or a special potion.
chapter.30.quest.62.description.1: This potion allows whoever drinks it to walk on ceilings like a Dropbear.
chapter.30.quest.63.description.1: A Kangaroo drop when they are sadly killed.
chapter.30.quest.64.description.1: Might as well cook up the meat.
chapter.30.quest.66.description.1: A Kangaroo that can be crafted into leather or some fancy pants.
chapter.30.quest.67.description.1: A drop from Cachalot Whales when they attack.
chapter.30.quest.68.description.1: A reward given by a whale for saving it from being beached.
chapter.30.quest.69.description.1: The Echolocator can locate nearby caves.
chapter.30.quest.7.description.1: This Crocodile item is dropped when baby crocodiles age up or are killed.
chapter.30.quest.70.description.1: The Endolocator can be used to locate the end portal.
chapter.30.quest.71.description.1: A rare drop from chamber blocks or Queens. Can be used to create new ant colonies when used on dirt or grass.
chapter.30.quest.72.description.1: This fungi can be used to feed ants and heal them or boost the Queen's reprodction. It can be collected by right clicking a moldy ant chamber under an anthill, where placing a shroomlight will stop the ants from being angry.
chapter.30.quest.73.description.1: A drop from Enderiophage, it can hold a stack of items inside which will be transported into whatever block is above them.
chapter.30.quest.74.description.1: A special firework with special DNA effect that can be made in the End.
chapter.30.quest.75.description.1: The Falconry Glove will allow you to pick up tamed Bald Eagles. Then by punching while pointing at a mob from long range will send the eagle off to attack it. If not hovering over a mob the eagle will just hop off.
chapter.30.quest.76.description.1: The Falconry Hood allows finer control of Bald Eagle flight, giving third-person control over the eagle's flight. The Eagle can fly up to 150 blocks out from its owner. Sneaking will stop the flying mode.
chapter.30.quest.77.description.1: A drop when a Tarantula Hawk is killed.
chapter.30.quest.79.description.1: An enhanced elytra with Tarantula Hawk wings that provides extra protection, durability, and enchantability.
chapter.30.quest.8.description.1: This crocodile armor will give you some protection but also increase your swim speed.
chapter.30.quest.80.description.1:
Encounter a Grizzly Bear


While these forest bears may seem cuddly, it is best to keep your distance from a Grizzly Bear as they may have young nearby that they will protect fiercely. Naturally they are very neutral mobs though.
chapter.30.quest.80.task.1.title: Grizzly Bear Encountered
chapter.30.quest.81.description.1: A Grizzly Bear can be tamed by waiting for it to eat some honey, or by feeding a honeycomb to the bear, then feeding it some salmon. They are fierce defenders and a good mount.
chapter.30.quest.81.task.1.title: Teddy the Bear
chapter.30.quest.82.description.1: The horn will allow you to add a third level to speed potions to help you get where you are going quicker.
chapter.30.quest.82.title: Potion of Swiftness III
chapter.30.quest.83.description.1: A crocodile is a large swamp and river based creature that is very dangerous to be near. You can still breed these creatures though with the use of rotten flesh. When the egg hatches, a nearby player is imprinted upon the baby and it will listen to their commands.
chapter.30.quest.83.task.1.title: Crocodile Encountered

chapter.33.quest.1.description.1:
Bellringer is a boss added by Meet Your Fight. It can be summoned by using a Haunted Bell. When killed, it drops 1 Phantoplasm and 3-4 Gold Ingots.


Bellringer floats above the ground and can pass through walls, similarly to a Vex. When targeting a player, it tries to constantly stay a few blocks in front and above its target.


All of its attacks consists of sending waves of projectiles that travel in a straight line after a short delay. Each projectile deals 8 damage on contact and can pass through walls. Bellringer randomly alternates between the following two attacks during the fight:


After falling below 50%, it rings its bell to apply Slowness II for 15 seconds to all nearby entities, then quickly fire 20 lines of projectiles at ground level that go toward its current target. After this attack is finished, Bellringer resumes its normal attacks, but each will fire 4 waves of projectiles instead of 3 for the rest of the fight.

chapter.33.quest.2.description.1:
Swampjaw is a boss added by Meet Your Fight. It can be summoned by using a Fossil Bait. When killed, it drops 1 Mossy Tooth, 3-6 Bones, 2-4 Vines, and 1-3 Dirt.


Swampjaw usually flies above its current target and moves like a Phantom, except it can see and fly through walls. When attacking it repeats the following pattern in the same order:
Orbit a few seconds around and above its target.
Rapidly move above its target to drop 3 mines, these explode when touching the ground with half the strength of TNT and do not destroy blocks or hurt Swampjaw.
Swoop down to charge its target, dealing 7 damage on contact. Damaging Swampjaw prematurely cancels this attack.
chapter.33.quest.28.description.1:
Gateways are a great way to farm mob drops after you have collected a few.


Every gate opened contains a link to a world full of a certain type of mob.  Waves and waves of those mobs will progressively pour forth, and each wave completed will spawn additional loot from that mob at that portal.


Completion of an entire portal will cause a massive amount of loot and experience to pour forth from the portal, and the portal will close.


To open a gateway, you must first craft a Gate Pearl.  A gate pearl will be able to open a specific portal size, attuned to a specific mob.  Simply craft the gate opener you want, and use it on the nearest block.


Once you've opened a gateway, your next goal is to close it.  You can close a gateway by completing each wave.  But be warned, failure to complete a wave on time will trigger a destabilization event, which will annihilate the gateway and may damage nearby things!


A gateway's max number of stages is indicated by its boss bar.  Every section on the bar represents a wave, and each section will tick down once it begins.  Clearing a wave will immediately end that wave's timer, and start the sequence for the next wave.  Every time a wave is completed, additional loot (as if more of the spawned mob had died) will spawn from the portal.  The more waves you clear, the more loot spawns at the center, but the stronger the spawned monsters become.  Each wave, the mobs that come forth will be exponentially stronger than their predecessors.  Upon completion of every wave, you will receive a large burst of experience and loot, and the portal will close with no adverse effects.

chapter.6.quest.1.description.1:
Eating a variety of nutrients with right balance will make you stronger and faster. Ignoring your nutritional balance can slow you down and weaken you.
Hover over a food to see which nutrients it provides along with the total number of Nutritional Units (NUs).


To see Nutritional Balance, press the 'n' key (configurable) or click nutrient button in your inventory.
- blue areas show your current level of each nutrient.
- green lines show the boundaries of the "target" area.
- red lines at the left show the "malnourishment" boundaries.
- red lines at the right show the "engorgement" boundaries.


Get all of your nutrients in the target areas to achieve a balanced diet and get a few buffs.


Avoid letting your nutrient levels cross the red boundaries or you will get some debuffs.

chapter.6.quest.37.description.1:
The Altar of the Sea is a block which allows you to recycle worthless enchanted items.


To begin, you need four enchanted items and a fair amount of experience.


Then, you place one enchanted item on each pillar (target the pillar and right click it while holding the item).


Once all four pillars hold an item, the Altar will begin to drain experience from nearby players.


The amount of experience required is based on the levels an rarities of the provided enchantments.  Once the experience has been drained, all four items will be consumed, and a newly created enchanted book will be created.


The new enchantments are random, but better enchantments will be obtained with higher levels and rarities of provided enchantments.  The Altar of the Sea can generate treasure enchantments.

chapter.6.quest.59.description.1:
You can wear backpacks in your Back curio slot or on your Chest.


The Open Backpack keybind can be used to open the backpack from your curios, or chest, hotbar, or inventory in that order.


The keybind also works by hovering over the backpack you want to open, while not having a backpack already open.


You can also place backpacks on the ground by sneak-using them. This allows them to be connected to a Simple Storage Network via cables.


Like a shulker box, backpacks will store their items when broken.


NOTICE: There is currently a bug with items not stacking when using a magnet. We cannot fix this on our end. Please use the Sort Container button (or Sort Backpack keybind) as a workaround.

chapter.6.quest.60.description.1:
The Enchantment Library is a block focused on storing enchantments.


Simply insert an enchanted book, and every enchantment on that book will be stored in the library internally.


Each enchantment is stored as one point multiplied by its level.


The library also records the max level it has ever seen for a given enchantment, and you may only extract enchantments up to that level.  Meaning if you want to be able to extract a higher level of an enchantment, the library will need to have had that level deposited at least one time.


To extract enchantments from the library, simply click on the enchantment you want to extract, and it will appear as an enchantment book in the output slot.


You can add more enchantments to the book by clicking another enchantment if it is compatible, and you can add more levels by clicking an enchantment again, if you have enough points.


Shift-Clicking an enchantment option will add the maximum level possible with the amount of points you have.


The enchantment library will not lose the enchantments if you break the block.
chapter.6.quest.61.description.1:
Anvils have significantly more utility than previously.


Anvils will spend your xp as points instead of xp levels.


Anvils have no level limit, and are enchantable with Unbreaking, Splitting, and Obliteration.


Splitting is a new enchantment that allows you to drop an anvil on an enchanted book with multiple enchantments, and receive an individual book for each level.


However, this process only has a 20% success chance per level of splitting, and will always cause damage to the anvil (but can be prevented by unbreaking).  Obliteration is similar, it has the same success rules, but it works on books with a single enchantment above level one.  It will create two books, each a level lower than the original.  Think of it as the inverse of combining two books in an anvil.

chapter.6.quest.77.description.1:
Players earns knowledge points each time they use a grave's soul to enchant an item, when they free a soul from a receptacle, by praying near a decorative grave with a special item called Ankh of Pray (with a cooldown of 6 in-game hours), or by accomplishing the tombstone advancements.


Theses points allow you to unlock some perks in a special gui "Knowledge of Death" (the keybind in "misc" is not defined by default).


The perks are small bonus related to all the features of tombstone, instead of providing them by default.
chapter.6.quest.77.subtitle: Chose your first knowledge of death
chapter.6.quest.78.description.1:
The decorative graves are special blocks with a fog particle only during the night.


The decorative graves can be haunted by a soul. The soul stays until used and allows some enchants like magic scroll/tablet, or upgrade the grave's key.


To build a decorative grave, you will need to collect Grave's Dust (the common way to obtain them is by killing undeads or with Cat Morning Gift), and one Essence of Undeath being an ingredient obtainable through the advancements (the first one is by finding how to select your favorite grave in the config in game) and rarely foundable on undeads, Cat Morning Gift and by fishing in deep water (but don't hope to find them by theses ways except by luck).


Rarely, a Grave Guardian can appear near a decorative grave. This guardian will protect the surroundings from hostile creatures and will offer to trade with the players. This is one way to obtain Grave's Dust and Essence of Undeath. During special events, the trades may differ.
chapter.6.quest.78.subtitle: Decorative graves
chapter.6.quest.78.task.3.title: Any #tombstone:decorative_graves
chapter.6.quest.8.description.1: Modded Dungeons love to give out a lot of these.
chapter.6.quest.8.title: Iron Armor
chapter.6.quest.81.description.1:
Project MMO allows players to advance through the game in their own unique method. Compared to traditional Minecraft gameplay where players have to craft powerful armors and weapons and later rely entirely on them for damage and protection, Project MMO introduces a more “RPG-styled” method of progressing through the game.


Starting the game you will not be able to use armor, decent tools and specific artifacts/relics/baubles, because this requires a certain level of the player associated with a specific item. In addition to the restrictions - leveling gives a variety of bonuses - passive(like improving your damage) or active(like the ability to salvage item for another one), thereby engaging in certain activities, you will improve your character.


As players perform a certain action, they would get better at doing so. For example, if a player wants to become the best warrior, they can train themselves by swinging their swords all day to earn more points in strength.


You will be able to see the settings of the mod when you press the P button
chapter.6.quest.81.subtitle: (brief explanation about stats)
chapter.6.quest.81.title: Experience, skills and character progression.

chapter.6.quest.83.title: Praise Hylia

chapter.6.quest.88.description.1:
Gather needed materials in Nether and prepare yourself to enter The End dimension!


To access the End, you must go through the process of finding a stronghold using eyes of ender, finding the portal room, and activating the end portal in the end portal room by filling the 12 end portal frames each with an eye of ender. Each frame block has a 10% chance of generating with an eye in it already, meaning you may not necessarily use 12 eyes to activate it.

chapter.7.quest.79.description.1:
- loot has a 25% chance to be doubled


- experience from all sources is increased by 20%


- all monsters have their health and damage increased by 20%(at night the bonus is doubled to 40%)


- Illusioner spawn naturally during the night


- new Elite Skeleton spawn naturally during the night(shoots arrows extremely precisely)


- Piglins may spawn in a group


- Pillagers may spawn in a group


- Creepers on explosion may spawn more Creeperlings


- Slimes have a chance to inflict Slowness effect


- Wither Skeletons may spawn with the Wither Sword instead of the Stone Sword


- Undead Army now has 4 waves


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are twice as likely to have enchanted items


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are twice as likely to have armor pieces


- Undead Army gives 100% more experience for completing it


- whenever you die from Bleeding or are killed by a Zombie there spawns a special Zombie with your head

Anvil Smithing is a new crafting mechanic added by Better End.


To start forging new items, place a Smithing Hammer on the left slot of an anvil and the ingredient on the right.
This can be the vanilla anvil or any of the 3 better end anvils.


Some items may need a certain tier of hammer or anvil to craft, like ender pearls to ender dust.

- loot has a 75% chance to be doubled


- experience from all sources is increased by 50%

- Phantom and new End Keeper spawn naturally near new structures


- Elite Skeleton may spawn in a group


- Enderman may teleport target on hit


- Shulker may inflict Blindness effect


- Creepers on explosion may spawn more Creeperlings


- Undead Army now has 5 waves


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are quadruple as likely to have enchanted items


- undead spawned during the Undead Army are thrice as likely to have armor pieces


- Undead Army now rewards with 2 Treasure Bags (instead of 1)


- Undead Army gives 200% more experience for completing it (instead of 100%)
